575  0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,
576  0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,
577  0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,
578  0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,
579  0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0
580 };

595 int inline gbGetValue(int min,int max,int v)
596 {
597  return (int)(min+(float)(max-min)*(2.0*(v/31.0)-(v/31.0)*(v/31.0)));
598 }
599 
600 void gbGenFilter()
601 {
602  for (int r=0;r<32;r++) {
603  for (int g=0;g<32;g++) {
604  for (int b=0;b<32;b++) {
605  int nr=gbGetValue(gbGetValue(4,14,g),
606  gbGetValue(24,29,g),r)-4;
607  int ng=gbGetValue(gbGetValue(4+gbGetValue(0,5,r),
608  14+gbGetValue(0,3,r),b),
609  gbGetValue(24+gbGetValue(0,3,r),
610  29+gbGetValue(0,1,r),b),g)-4;
611  int nb=gbGetValue(gbGetValue(4+gbGetValue(0,5,r),
612  14+gbGetValue(0,3,r),g),
613  gbGetValue(24+gbGetValue(0,3,r),
614  29+gbGetValue(0,1,r),g),b)-4;
615  gbColorFilter[(b<<10)|(g<<5)|r]=(nb<<10)|(ng<<5)|nr;
616  }
617  }
618  }
619 }
620 
621 bool gbIsGameboyRom(char * file)
622 {
623  if(strlen(file) > 4) {
624  char * p = strrchr(file,'.');
625 
626  if(p != NULL) {
627  if(_stricmp(p, ".gb") == 0)
628  return true;
629  if(_stricmp(p, ".gbc") == 0)
630  return true;
631  if(_stricmp(p, ".cgb") == 0)
632  return true;
633  if(_stricmp(p, ".sgb") == 0)
634  return true;
635  }
636  }
637 
638  return false;
639 }
640 
641 void gbCopyMemory(u16 d, u16 s, int count)
642 {
643  while(count) {
644  gbMemoryMap[d>>12][d & 0x0fff] = gbMemoryMap[s>>12][s & 0x0fff];
645  s++;
646  d++;
647  count--;
648  }
649 }
650 
651 void gbDoHdma()
652 {
653 
654  gbCopyMemory((gbHdmaDestination & 0x1ff0) | 0x8000,
655  gbHdmaSource & 0xfff0,
656  0x10);
657 
658  gbHdmaDestination += 0x10;
659  if (gbHdmaDestination == 0xa000)
660  gbHdmaDestination = 0x8000;
661 
662  gbHdmaSource += 0x10;
663  if (gbHdmaSource == 0x8000)
664  gbHdmaSource = 0xa000;
665 
666  register_HDMA2 = gbHdmaSource & 0xff;
667  register_HDMA1 = gbHdmaSource>>8;
668 
669  register_HDMA4 = gbHdmaDestination & 0xff;
670  register_HDMA3 = gbHdmaDestination>>8;
671 
672  gbHdmaBytes -= 0x10;
673  gbMemory[0xff55] = --register_HDMA5;
674  if(register_HDMA5 == 0xff)
675  gbHdmaOn = 0;
676 
677 // We need to add the dmaClockticks for HDMA !
678  if(gbSpeed)
679  gbDmaTicks = 17;
680  else
681  gbDmaTicks = 9;
682 
683  if (IFF & 0x80)
684  gbDmaTicks++;
685 
686 }
687 
688 // fix for Harley and Lego Racers
689 void gbCompareLYToLYC()
690 {
691  if(register_LCDC & 0x80) {
692  if(register_LY == register_LYC) {
693 
694  // mark that we have a match
695  register_STAT |= 4;
696 
697  // check if we need an interrupt
698  if (register_STAT & 0x40)
699  {
700  // send LCD interrupt only if no interrupt 48h signal...
701  if (!gbInt48Signal)
702  {
703  register_IF |=2;
704  }
705  gbInt48Signal |= 8;
706  }
707  }
708  else // no match
709  {
710  register_STAT &= 0xfb;
711  gbInt48Signal &=~8;
712  }
713  }
714 }
715 
716 void gbWriteMemory(register u16 address, register u8 value)
717 {
718 
719  if(address < 0x8000) {
720 #ifndef FINAL_VERSION
721  if(memorydebug && (address>0x3fff || address < 0x2000)) {
722  log("Memory register write %04x=%02x PC=%04x\n",
723  address,
724  value,
725  PC.W);
726  }
727 
728 #endif
729  if(mapper)
730  (*mapper)(address, value);
731  return;
732 
733  }
734 
735  if(address < 0xa000) {
736  // No access to Vram during mode 3
737  // (used to emulate the gfx differences between GB & GBC-GBA/SP in Stunt Racer)
738  if ((gbLcdModeDelayed !=3) ||
739  // This part is used to emulate a small difference between hardwares
740  // (check 8-in-1's arrow on GBA/GBC to verify it)
741  ((register_LY == 0) && ((gbHardware & 0xa) && (gbScreenOn==false) &&
742  (register_LCDC & 0x80)) &&
743  (gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed ==(GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS-GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS))))
744  gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address&0x0fff] = value;
745  return;
746  }
747 
748  // Used for the mirroring of 0xC000 in 0xE000
749  if ((address >= 0xe000) && (address < 0xfe00))
750  address &= ~0x2000;
751 
752  if(address < 0xc000) {
753 #ifndef FINAL_VERSION
754  if(memorydebug) {
755  log("Memory register write %04x=%02x PC=%04x\n",
756  address,
757  value,
758  PC.W);
759  }
760 #endif
761 
762  // Is that a correct fix ??? (it used to be 'if (mapper)')...
763  if(mapperRAM)
764  (*mapperRAM)(address, value);
765  return;
766  }
767 
768 
769  if(address < 0xfe00) {
770  gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address & 0x0fff] = value;
771  return;
772  }
773 
774  // OAM not accessible during mode 2 & 3.
775  if(address < 0xfea0)
776  {
777  if (((gbHardware & 0xa) && ((gbLcdMode | gbLcdModeDelayed) &2)) ||
778  ((gbHardware & 5) && (((gbLcdModeDelayed == 2) &&
779  (gbLcdTicksDelayed<=GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS)) ||
780  (gbLcdModeDelayed == 3))))
781  return;
782  else
783  {
784  gbMemory[address] = value;
785  return;
786  }
787  }
788 
789 
790 
791  if((address > 0xfea0) && (address < 0xff00)){ // GBC allows reading/writing to that area
792  gbMemory[address] = value;
793  return;
794  }
795 
796  switch(address & 0x00ff) {
797 
798  case 0x00: {
799  gbMemory[0xff00] = ((gbMemory[0xff00] & 0xcf) |
800  (value & 0x30) | 0xc0);
801  if(gbSgbMode) {
802  gbSgbDoBitTransfer(value);
803  }
804  return;
805  }
806 
807  case 0x01: {
808  gbMemory[0xff01] = value;
809  return;
810  }
811 
812  // serial control
813  case 0x02: {
814  gbSerialOn = (value & 0x80);
815  gbMemory[0xff02] = value;
816  if(gbSerialOn) {
817  gbSerialTicks = GBSERIAL_CLOCK_TICKS;
818 #ifdef LINK_EMULATION
819  if(linkConnected) {
820  if(value & 1) {
821  linkSendByte(0x100|gbMemory[0xFF01]);
822  Sleep(5);
823  }
824  }
825 #endif
826  }
827 
828  gbSerialBits = 0;
829  return;
830  }
831 
832  case 0x04: {
833  // DIV register resets on any write
834  // (not totally perfect, but better than nothing)
835  gbMemory[0xff04] = register_DIV = 0;
836  gbDivTicks = GBDIV_CLOCK_TICKS;
837  // Another weird timer 'bug' :
838  // Writing to DIV register resets the internal timer,
839  // and can also increase TIMA/trigger an interrupt
840  // in some cases...
841  if (gbTimerOn && !(gbInternalTimer & (gbTimerClockTicks>>1)))
842  {
843  gbMemory[0xff05] = ++register_TIMA;
844  if(register_TIMA == 0) {
845  // timer overflow!
846 
847  // reload timer modulo
848  gbMemory[0xff05] = register_TIMA = register_TMA;
849 
850  // flag interrupt
851  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF |= 4;
852  }
853  }
854  gbInternalTimer = 0xff;
855  return;
856  }
857  case 0x05:
858  gbMemory[0xff05] = register_TIMA = value;
859  return;
860 
861  case 0x06:
862  gbMemory[0xff06] = register_TMA = value;
863  return;
864 
865  // TIMER control
866  case 0x07: {
867 
868  gbTimerModeChange = (((value & 3) != (register_TAC&3)) && (value & register_TAC & 4)) ? true : false;
869  gbTimerOnChange = (((value ^ register_TAC) & 4) == 4) ? true : false;
870 
871  gbTimerOn = (value & 4) ? true : false;
872 
873  if (gbTimerOnChange || gbTimerModeChange)
874  {
875  gbTimerMode = value & 3;
876 
877  switch(gbTimerMode) {
878  case 0:
879  gbTimerClockTicks = GBTIMER_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS;
880  break;
881  case 1:
882  gbTimerClockTicks = GBTIMER_MODE_1_CLOCK_TICKS;
883  break;
884  case 2:
885  gbTimerClockTicks = GBTIMER_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS;
886  break;
887  case 3:
888  gbTimerClockTicks = GBTIMER_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS;
889  break;
890  }
891  }
892 
893 
894  // This looks weird, but this emulates a bug in which register_TIMA
895  // is increased when writing to register_TAC
896  // (This fixes Korodice's long-delay between menus bug).
897 
898  if (gbTimerOnChange || gbTimerModeChange)
899  {
900  bool temp = false;
901 
902  if ((gbTimerOn && !gbTimerModeChange) && (gbTimerMode & 2) &&
903  !(gbInternalTimer & 0x80) && (gbInternalTimer & (gbTimerClockTicks>>1)) &&
904  !(gbInternalTimer & (gbTimerClockTicks>>5)))
905  temp = true;
906  else if ((!gbTimerOn && !gbTimerModeChange && gbTimerOnChange ) && ((gbTimerTicks-1) < (gbTimerClockTicks>>1)))
907  temp = true;
908  else if (gbTimerOn && gbTimerModeChange && !gbTimerOnChange)
909  {
910  switch(gbTimerMode & 3)
911  {
912  case 0x00:
913  temp = false;
914  break;
915  case 0x01:
916  if (((gbInternalTimer & 0x82) == 2) && (gbTimerTicks>(clockTicks+1)))
917  temp = true;
918  break;
919  case 0x02:
920  if (((gbInternalTimer & 0x88) == 0x8) && (gbTimerTicks>(clockTicks+1)))
921  temp = true;
922  break;
923  case 0x03:
924  if (((gbInternalTimer & 0xA0) == 0x20) && (gbTimerTicks>(clockTicks+1)))
925  temp = true;
926  break;
927  }
928  }
929 
930  if (temp)
931  {
932  gbMemory[0xff05] = ++register_TIMA;
933  if((register_TIMA & 0xff) == 0) {
934  // timer overflow!
935 
936  // reload timer modulo
937  gbMemory[0xff05] = register_TIMA = register_TMA;
938 
939  // flag interrupt
940  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF |= 4;
941  }
942  }
943  }
944  gbMemory[0xff07] = register_TAC = value;
945  return;
946  }
947 
948  case 0x0f: {
949  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF = value;
950  //gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IE |= value;
951  return;
952  }
953 
954  case 0x10:
955  case 0x11:
956  case 0x12:
957  case 0x13:
958  case 0x14:
959  case 0x16:
960  case 0x17:
961  case 0x18:
962  case 0x19:
963  case 0x1a:
964  case 0x1b:
965  case 0x1c:
966  case 0x1d:
967  case 0x1e:
968  case 0x20:
969  case 0x21:
970  case 0x22:
971  case 0x23:
972  case 0x24:
973  case 0x25: {
974  if (gbMemory[NR52] & 0x80) {
975  SOUND_EVENT(address,value);
976  return;
977  }
978  }
979 
980  case 0x26: {
981  SOUND_EVENT(address,value);
982  return;
983  }
984 
985  case 0x30:
986  case 0x31:
987  case 0x32:
988  case 0x33:
989  case 0x34:
990  case 0x35:
991  case 0x36:
992  case 0x37:
993  case 0x38:
994  case 0x39:
995  case 0x3a:
996  case 0x3b:
997  case 0x3c:
998  case 0x3d:
999  case 0x3e:
1000  case 0x3f: {
1001  gbMemory[address] = value;
1002  return;
1003  }
1004 
1005  case 0x40: {
1006  int lcdChange = (register_LCDC & 0x80) ^ (value & 0x80);
1007 
1008  // don't draw the window if it was not enabled and not being drawn before
1009  if(!(register_LCDC & 0x20) && (value & 0x20) && gbWindowLine == -1 &&
1010  register_LY > register_WY)
1011  gbWindowLine = 146;
1012  // 007 fix : don't draw the first window's 1st line if it's enable 'too late'
1013  // (ie. if register_LY == register_WY when enabling it)
1014  // and move it to the next line
1015  else if (!(register_LCDC & 0x20) && (value & 0x20) && (register_LY == register_WY))
1016  gbWindowLine = -2;
1017 
1018 
1019  gbMemory[0xff40] = register_LCDC = value;
1020 
1021 
1022  if(lcdChange) {
1023  if((value & 0x80) && (!register_LCDCBusy)) {
1024 
1025  // if (!gbWhiteScreen && !gbSgbMask)
1026 
1027  // systemDrawScreen();
1028 
1029 
1030 
1031  gbRegisterLYLCDCOffOn = (register_LY + 144) % 154;
1032 
1033  gbLcdTicks = GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS - (gbSpeed ? 2 : 1);
1034  gbLcdTicksDelayed = GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS - (gbSpeed ? 1 : 0);
1035  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks = GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS - (gbSpeed ? 2 : 1);
1036  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed = GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS - (gbSpeed ? 1 : 0);
1037  gbLcdMode = 2;
1038  gbLcdModeDelayed = 2;
1039  gbMemory[0xff41] = register_STAT = (register_STAT & 0xfc) | 2;
1040  gbMemory[0xff44] = register_LY = 0x00;
1041  gbInt48Signal = 0;
1042  gbLYChangeHappened = false;
1043  gbLCDChangeHappened = false;
1044  gbWindowLine = 146;
1045  oldRegister_WY = 146;
1046 
1047  // Fix for Namco Gallery Vol.2
1048  // (along with updating register_LCDC at the start of 'case 0x40') :
1049  if(register_STAT & 0x20)
1050  {
1051  // send LCD interrupt only if no interrupt 48h signal...
1052  if (!gbInt48Signal)
1053  {
1054  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF |= 2;
1055  }
1056  gbInt48Signal |= 4;
1057  }
1058  gbCompareLYToLYC();
1059 
1060  } else {
1061 
1062  register_LCDCBusy = clockTicks+6;
1063 
1064  //used to update the screen with white lines when it's off.
1065  //(it looks strange, but it's pretty accurate)
1066 
1067  gbWhiteScreen = 0;
1068 
1069  gbScreenTicks = ((150-register_LY)*GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS +
1070  (49<<(gbSpeed ? 1 : 0)));
1071 
1072  // disable the screen rendering
1073  gbScreenOn = false;
1074  gbLcdTicks = 0;
1075  gbLcdMode = 0;
1076  gbLcdModeDelayed = 0;
1077  gbMemory[0xff41] = register_STAT &= 0xfc;
1078  gbInt48Signal = 0;
1079  }
1080  }
1081  return;
1082  }
1083 
1084  // STAT
1085  case 0x41: {
1086  //register_STAT = (register_STAT & 0x87) |
1087  // (value & 0x7c);
1088  gbMemory[0xff41] = register_STAT = (value & 0xf8) | (register_STAT & 0x07); // fix ?
1089  // GB bug from Devrs FAQ
1090  // Corrected : it happens if Lcd Mode<2, but also if LY == LYC whatever
1091  // Lcd Mode is, and if !gbInt48Signal in all cases. The screen being off
1092  // doesn't matter (the bug will still happen).
1093  // That fixes 'Satoru Nakajima - F-1 Hero' crash bug.
1094 
1095  if((gbHardware & 5) && (((!gbInt48Signal) && (gbLcdMode<2) && (register_LCDC & 0x80)) ||
1096  (register_LY == register_LYC)))
1097  {
1098  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF |=2;
1099  }
1100 
1101  gbInt48Signal &= ((register_STAT>>3) & 0xF);
1102 
1103  if((register_LCDC & 0x80)) {
1104  if ((register_STAT & 0x08) && (gbLcdMode == 0))
1105  {
1106  if (!gbInt48Signal)
1107  {
1108  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF |=2;
1109  }
1110  gbInt48Signal |= 1;
1111  }
1112  if ((register_STAT & 0x10) && (gbLcdMode == 1))
1113  {
1114  if (!gbInt48Signal)
1115  {
1116  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF |=2;
1117  }
1118  gbInt48Signal |= 2;
1119  }
1120  if ((register_STAT & 0x20) && (gbLcdMode == 2))
1121  {
1122  if (!gbInt48Signal)
1123  {
1124  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF |=2;
1125  }
1126  gbInt48Signal |= 4;
1127  }
1128  gbCompareLYToLYC();
1129 
1130  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF;
1131  gbMemory[0xff41] = register_STAT;
1132 
1133  }
1134  return;
1135  }
1136 
1137  // SCY
1138  case 0x42: {
1139  int temp = -1;
1140 
1141  if ((gbLcdMode == 3) || (gbLcdModeDelayed == 3))
1142  temp = ((GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS-GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS) -
1143  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks);
1144 
1145  if (temp >=0)
1146  {
1147  for (int i=temp<<(gbSpeed ? 1 : 2);i<300;i++)
1148  if (temp < 300)
1149  gbSCYLine[i] = value;
1150  }
1151 
1152  else
1153  memset(gbSCYLine, value, sizeof(gbSCYLine));
1154 
1155  gbMemory[0xff42] = register_SCY = value;
1156  return;
1157  }
1158 
1159  // SCX
1160  case 0x43: {
1161  int temp = -1;
1162 
1163  if (gbLcdModeDelayed == 3)
1164  temp = ((GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS-GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS) -
1165  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed);
1166 
1167  if (temp >=0)
1168  {
1169  for (int i=temp<<(gbSpeed ? 1 : 2);i<300;i++)
1170  if (temp < 300)
1171  gbSCXLine[i] = value;
1172  }
1173 
1174  else
1175  memset(gbSCXLine, value, sizeof(gbSCXLine));
1176 
1177  gbMemory[0xff43] = register_SCX = value;
1178  return;
1179  }
1180 
1181  // LY
1182  case 0x44: {
1183  // read only
1184  return;
1185  }
1186 
1187  // LYC
1188  case 0x45: {
1189  if (register_LYC != value)
1190  {
1191  gbMemory[0xff45] = register_LYC = value;
1192  if(register_LCDC & 0x80) {
1193  gbCompareLYToLYC();
1194  }
1195  }
1196  return;
1197  }
1198 
1199  // DMA!
1200  case 0x46: {
1201  int source = value * 0x0100;
1202 
1203  gbCopyMemory(0xfe00,
1204  source,
1205  0xa0);
1206  gbMemory[0xff46] = register_DMA = value;
1207  return;
1208  }
1209 
1210  // BGP
1211  case 0x47: {
1212 
1213  int temp = -1;
1214 
1215  gbMemory[0xff47] = value;
1216 
1217  if (gbLcdModeDelayed == 3)
1218  temp = ((GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS-GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS) -
1219  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed);
1220 
1221  if (temp >=0)
1222  {
1223  for (int i=temp<<(gbSpeed ? 1 : 2);i<300;i++)
1224  if (temp < 300)
1225  gbBgpLine[i] = value;
1226  }
1227  else
1228  memset(gbBgpLine,value,sizeof(gbBgpLine));
1229 
1230  gbBgp[0] = value & 0x03;
1231  gbBgp[1] = (value & 0x0c)>>2;
1232  gbBgp[2] = (value & 0x30)>>4;
1233  gbBgp[3] = (value & 0xc0)>>6;
1234  break;
1235  }
1236 
1237  // OBP0
1238  case 0x48: {
1239  int temp = -1;
1240 
1241  gbMemory[0xff48] = value;
1242 
1243  if (gbLcdModeDelayed == 3)
1244  temp = ((GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS-GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS) -
1245  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed);
1246 
1247  if (temp >=0)
1248  {
1249  for (int i=temp<<(gbSpeed ? 1 : 2);i<300;i++)
1250  if (temp < 300)
1251  gbObp0Line[i] = value;
1252  }
1253  else
1254  memset(gbObp0Line,value,sizeof(gbObp0Line));
1255 
1256  gbObp0[0] = value & 0x03;
1257  gbObp0[1] = (value & 0x0c)>>2;
1258  gbObp0[2] = (value & 0x30)>>4;
1259  gbObp0[3] = (value & 0xc0)>>6;
1260  break;
1261  }
1262 
1263  // OBP1
1264  case 0x49: {
1265  int temp = -1;
1266 
1267  gbMemory[0xff49] = value;
1268 
1269  if (gbLcdModeDelayed == 3)
1270  temp = ((GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS-GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS) -
1271  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed);
1272 
1273  if (temp >=0)
1274  {
1275  for (int i=temp<<(gbSpeed ? 1 : 2);i<300;i++)
1276  if (temp < 300)
1277  gbObp1Line[i] = value;
1278  }
1279  else
1280  memset(gbObp1Line,value,sizeof(gbObp1Line));
1281 
1282  gbObp1[0] = value & 0x03;
1283  gbObp1[1] = (value & 0x0c)>>2;
1284  gbObp1[2] = (value & 0x30)>>4;
1285  gbObp1[3] = (value & 0xc0)>>6;
1286  break;
1287  }
1288 
1289  // WY
1290  case 0x4a:
1291  gbMemory[0xff4a] = register_WY = value;
1292  if ((register_LY <= register_WY) && ((gbWindowLine < 0) || (gbWindowLine>=144)))
1293  {
1294  gbWindowLine = -1;
1295  oldRegister_WY = register_WY;
1296  }
1297  return;
1298 
1299  // WX
1300  case 0x4b:
1301  gbMemory[0xff4b] = register_WX = value;
1302  return;
1303 
1304  // KEY1
1305  case 0x4d: {
1306  if(gbCgbMode) {
1307  gbMemory[0xff4d] = (gbMemory[0xff4d] & 0x80) | (value & 1) | 0x7e;
1308  return;
1309  }
1310  }
1311  break;
1312 
1313  // VBK
1314  case 0x4f: {
1315  if(gbCgbMode) {
1316  value = value & 1;
1317  if(value == gbVramBank)
1318  return;
1319 
1320  int vramAddress = value * 0x2000;
1321  gbMemoryMap[0x08] = &gbVram[vramAddress];
1322  gbMemoryMap[0x09] = &gbVram[vramAddress + 0x1000];
1323 
1324  gbVramBank = value;
1325  register_VBK = value;
1326  }
1327  return;
1328  }
1329  break;
1330 
1331  // BOOTROM disable register (also gbCgbMode enabler if value & 0x10 ?)
1332  case 0x50 :
1333  {
1334  if (useBios && inBios && !skipBios && (value & 1))
1335  {
1336  gbMemoryMap[0x00] = &gbRom[0x0000];
1337  memcpy ((u8 *)(gbRom+0x100), (u8 *)(gbMemory + 0x100), 0xF00);
1338  inBios = false;
1339  }
1340  }
1341 
1342  // HDMA1
1343  case 0x51: {
1344  if(gbCgbMode) {
1345  if(value > 0x7f && value < 0xa0)
1346  value = 0;
1347 
1348  gbHdmaSource = (value << 8) | (gbHdmaSource & 0xf0);
1349 
1350  register_HDMA1 = value;
1351  return;
1352  }
1353  }
1354  break;
1355 
1356  // HDMA2
1357  case 0x52: {
1358  if(gbCgbMode) {
1359  value = value & 0xf0;
1360 
1361  gbHdmaSource = (gbHdmaSource & 0xff00) | (value);
1362 
1363  register_HDMA2 = value;
1364  return;
1365  }
1366  }
1367  break;
1368 
1369  // HDMA3
1370  case 0x53: {
1371  if(gbCgbMode) {
1372  value = value & 0x1f;
1373  gbHdmaDestination = (value << 8) | (gbHdmaDestination & 0xf0);
1374  gbHdmaDestination |= 0x8000;
1375  register_HDMA3 = value;
1376  return;
1377  }
1378  }
1379  break;
1380 
1381  // HDMA4
1382  case 0x54: {
1383  if(gbCgbMode) {
1384  value = value & 0xf0;
1385  gbHdmaDestination = (gbHdmaDestination & 0x1f00) | value;
1386  gbHdmaDestination |= 0x8000;
1387  register_HDMA4 = value;
1388  return;
1389  }
1390  }
1391  break;
1392 
1393  // HDMA5
1394  case 0x55: {
1395 
1396  if(gbCgbMode) {
1397  gbHdmaBytes = 16 + (value & 0x7f) * 16;
1398  if(gbHdmaOn) {
1399  if(value & 0x80) {
1400  gbMemory[0xff55] = register_HDMA5 = (value & 0x7f);
1401  } else {
1402  register_HDMA5 = 0xff;
1403  gbHdmaOn = 0;
1404  }
1405  } else {
1406  if(value & 0x80) {
1407  gbHdmaOn = 1;
1408  gbMemory[0xff55] = register_HDMA5 = value & 0x7f;
1409  if(gbLcdModeDelayed == 0)
1410  gbDoHdma();
1411  } else {
1412  // we need to take the time it takes to complete the transfer into
1413  // account... according to GB DEV FAQs, the setup time is the same
1414  // for single and double speed, but the actual transfer takes the
1415  // same time
1416  if(gbSpeed)
1417  gbDmaTicks = 2+16 * ((value & 0x7f) +1);
1418  else
1419  gbDmaTicks = 1+8 * ((value & 0x7f)+1);
1420 
1421  gbCopyMemory((gbHdmaDestination & 0x1ff0) | 0x8000,
1422  gbHdmaSource & 0xfff0,
1423  gbHdmaBytes);
1424  gbHdmaDestination += gbHdmaBytes;
1425  gbHdmaSource += gbHdmaBytes;
1426 
1427  gbMemory[0xff51] = register_HDMA1 = 0xff;// = (gbHdmaSource >> 8) & 0xff;
1428  gbMemory[0xff52] = register_HDMA2 = 0xff;// = gbHdmaSource & 0xf0;
1429  gbMemory[0xff53] = register_HDMA3 = 0xff;// = ((gbHdmaDestination - 0x8000) >> 8) & 0x1f;
1430  gbMemory[0xff54] = register_HDMA4 = 0xff;// = gbHdmaDestination & 0xf0;
1431  gbMemory[0xff55] = register_HDMA5 = 0xff;
1432  }
1433  }
1434  return;
1435  }
1436  }
1437  break;
1438 
1439  // BCPS
1440  case 0x68: {
1441  if(gbCgbMode) {
1442  int paletteIndex = (value & 0x3f) >> 1;
1443  int paletteHiLo = (value & 0x01);
1444 
1445  gbMemory[0xff68] = value;
1446 
1447  gbMemory[0xff69] = (paletteHiLo ?
1448  (gbPalette[paletteIndex] >> 8) :
1449  (gbPalette[paletteIndex] & 0x00ff));
1450  return;
1451  }
1452  }
1453  break;
1454 
1455  // BCPD
1456  case 0x69: {
1457  if(gbCgbMode) {
1458  int v = gbMemory[0xff68];
1459  int paletteIndex = (v & 0x3f) >> 1;
1460  int paletteHiLo = (v & 0x01);
1461 
1462  // No access to gbPalette during mode 3 (Color Panel Demo)
1463  if (((gbLcdModeDelayed != 3) && (!((gbLcdMode == 0) && (gbLcdTicks>=(GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS-gbSpritesTicks[299]-1)))) && (!gbSpeed)) ||
1464  (gbSpeed && ((gbLcdMode == 1) || (gbLcdMode == 2) ||
1465  ((gbLcdMode == 3) && (gbLcdTicks>(GBLCD_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS-2))) ||
1466  ((gbLcdMode == 0) && (gbLcdTicks<=(GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS-gbSpritesTicks[299]-2))))))
1467  {
1468  gbMemory[0xff69] = value;
1469  gbPalette[paletteIndex] = (paletteHiLo ?
1470  ((value << 8) | (gbPalette[paletteIndex] & 0xff)) :
1471  ((gbPalette[paletteIndex] & 0xff00) | (value))) & 0x7fff;
1472  }
1473 
1474 
1475  if(gbMemory[0xff68] & 0x80) {
1476  int index = ((gbMemory[0xff68] & 0x3f) + 1) & 0x3f;
1477 
1478  gbMemory[0xff68] = (gbMemory[0xff68] & 0x80) | index;
1479  gbMemory[0xff69] = (index & 1 ?
1480  (gbPalette[index>>1] >> 8) :
1481  (gbPalette[index>>1] & 0x00ff));
1482  }
1483  return;
1484  }
1485  }
1486  break;
1487 
1488  // OCPS
1489  case 0x6a: {
1490  if(gbCgbMode) {
1491  int paletteIndex = (value & 0x3f) >> 1;
1492  int paletteHiLo = (value & 0x01);
1493 
1494  paletteIndex += 32;
1495 
1496  gbMemory[0xff6a] = value;
1497 
1498  gbMemory[0xff6b] = (paletteHiLo ?
1499  (gbPalette[paletteIndex] >> 8) :
1500  (gbPalette[paletteIndex] & 0x00ff));
1501  return;
1502  }
1503  }
1504  break;
1505 
1506  // OCPD
1507  case 0x6b: {
1508 
1509  if(gbCgbMode) {
1510  int v = gbMemory[0xff6a];
1511  int paletteIndex = (v & 0x3f) >> 1;
1512  int paletteHiLo = (v & 0x01);
1513 
1514  paletteIndex += 32;
1515 
1516  // No access to gbPalette during mode 3 (Color Panel Demo)
1517  if (((gbLcdModeDelayed != 3) && (!((gbLcdMode == 0) && (gbLcdTicks>=(GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS-gbSpritesTicks[299]-1)))) && (!gbSpeed)) ||
1518  (gbSpeed && ((gbLcdMode == 1) || (gbLcdMode == 2) ||
1519  ((gbLcdMode == 3) && (gbLcdTicks>(GBLCD_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS-2))) ||
1520  ((gbLcdMode == 0) && (gbLcdTicks<=(GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS-gbSpritesTicks[299]-2))))))
1521  {
1522  gbMemory[0xff6b] = value;
1523  gbPalette[paletteIndex] = (paletteHiLo ?
1524  ((value << 8) | (gbPalette[paletteIndex] & 0xff)) :
1525  ((gbPalette[paletteIndex] & 0xff00) | (value))) & 0x7fff;
1526  }
1527 
1528  if(gbMemory[0xff6a] & 0x80) {
1529  int index = ((gbMemory[0xff6a] & 0x3f) + 1) & 0x3f;
1530 
1531  gbMemory[0xff6a] = (gbMemory[0xff6a] & 0x80) | index;
1532 
1533  gbMemory[0xff6b] = (index & 1 ?
1534  (gbPalette[(index>>1) + 32] >> 8) :
1535  (gbPalette[(index>>1) + 32] & 0x00ff));
1536  }
1537  return;
1538  }
1539  }
1540  break;
1541 
1542  case 0x6c: {
1543  gbMemory[0xff6c] = 0xfe | value;
1544  return;
1545  }
1546 
1547 
1548  // SVBK
1549  case 0x70: {
1550  if(gbCgbMode) {
1551  value = value & 7;
1552 
1553  int bank = value;
1554  if(value == 0)
1555  bank = 1;
1556 
1557  if(bank == gbWramBank)
1558  return;
1559 
1560  int wramAddress = bank * 0x1000;
1561  gbMemoryMap[0x0d] = &gbWram[wramAddress];
1562 
1563  gbWramBank = bank;
1564  gbMemory[0xff70] = register_SVBK = value;
1565  return;
1566  }
1567  }
1568 
1569  case 0x75:{
1570  gbMemory[0xff75] = 0x8f | value;
1571  return;
1572  }
1573 
1574  case 0xff: {
1575  gbMemory[0xffff] = register_IE = value;
1576  return;
1577  }
1578  }
1579 
1580  if(address < 0xff80)
1581  {
1582  gbMemory[address] = value;
1583  return;
1584  }
1585 
1586  gbMemory[address] = value;
1587 }
1588 
1589 u8 gbReadOpcode(register u16 address)
1590 {
1591  if(gbCheatMap[address])
1592  return gbCheatRead(address);
1593 
1594  if(address < 0x8000)
1595  return gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address&0x0fff];
1596 
1597  if(address < 0xa000)
1598  {
1599  // A lot of 'ugly' checks... But only way to emulate this particular behaviour...
1600  if (((gbHardware & 0xa) && ((gbLcdModeDelayed !=3) || ((register_LY == 0) &&
1601  (gbScreenOn==false) && (register_LCDC & 0x80)) &&
1602  (gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed ==(GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS-GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS)))) ||
1603  ((gbHardware & 0x5) && (gbLcdModeDelayed !=3) &&
1604  ((gbLcdMode !=3) || ((register_LY == 0) && ((gbScreenOn==false) &&
1605  (register_LCDC & 0x80)) &&
1606  (gbLcdLYIncrementTicks ==(GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS-GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS))))))
1607  return gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address&0x0fff];
1608  return 0xff;
1609  }
1610 
1611  // Used for the mirroring of 0xC000 in 0xE000
1612  if ((address >= 0xe000) && (address < 0xfe00))
1613  address &= ~0x2000;
1614 
1615  switch(address & 0xf000) {
1616  case 0x0a:
1617  case 0x0b:
1618  if(mapperReadRAM)
1619  return mapperReadRAM(address);
1620  break;
1621  case 0x0f:
1622  if(address > 0xff00) {
1623  switch(address & 0x00ff) {
1624  case 0x02:
1625  return (gbMemory[0xff02]);
1626  case 0x03:
1627  return (0xff);
1628  case 0x04:
1629  return register_DIV;
1630  case 0x05:
1631  return register_TIMA;
1632  case 0x06:
1633  return register_TMA;
1634  case 0x07:
1635  return (0xf8 | register_TAC);
1636  case 0x08:
1637  case 0x09:
1638  case 0x0a:
1639  case 0x0b:
1640  case 0x0c:
1641  case 0x0d:
1642  case 0x0e:
1643  return (0xff);
1644  case 0x0f:
1645  return (0xe0 | gbMemory[0xff0f]);
1646  case 0x40:
1647  return register_LCDC;
1648  case 0x41:
1649  // This is a GB/C only bug (ie. not GBA/SP).
1650  if ((gbHardware & 7) && (gbLcdMode == 2) && (gbLcdModeDelayed == 1) && (!gbSpeed))
1651  return (0x80 | gbMemory[0xff41] & 0xFC);
1652  else
1653  return (0x80 | gbMemory[0xff41]);
1654  case 0x42:
1655  return register_SCY;
1656  case 0x43:
1657  return register_SCX;
1658  case 0x44:
1659  if (((gbHardware & 7) && ((gbLcdMode == 1) && (gbLcdTicks == 0x71))) ||
1660  (!(register_LCDC && 0x80)))
1661  return 0;
1662  else
1663  return register_LY;
1664  case 0x45:
1665  return register_LYC;
1666  case 0x46:
1667  return register_DMA;
1668  case 0x4a:
1669  return register_WY;
1670  case 0x4b:
1671  return register_WX;
1672  case 0x4c:
1673  return 0xff;
1674  case 0x4f:
1675  return (0xfe | register_VBK);
1676  case 0x51:
1677  return register_HDMA1;
1678  case 0x52:
1679  return register_HDMA2;
1680  case 0x53:
1681  return register_HDMA3;
1682  case 0x54:
1683  return register_HDMA4;
1684  case 0x55:
1685  return register_HDMA5;
1686  case 0x68:
1687  case 0x6a:
1688  if (gbCgbMode)
1689  return (0x40 | gbMemory[address]);
1690  else
1691  return 0xc0;
1692  case 0x69:
1693  case 0x6b:
1694  if (gbCgbMode)
1695  {
1696  // No access to gbPalette during mode 3 (Color Panel Demo)
1697  if (((gbLcdModeDelayed != 3) && (!((gbLcdMode == 0) && (gbLcdTicks>=(GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS-gbSpritesTicks[299]-1)))) && (!gbSpeed)) ||
1698  (gbSpeed && ((gbLcdMode == 1) || (gbLcdMode == 2) ||
1699  ((gbLcdMode == 3) && (gbLcdTicks>(GBLCD_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS-2))) ||
1700  ((gbLcdMode == 0) && (gbLcdTicks<=(GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS-gbSpritesTicks[299]-2))))))
1701  return (gbMemory[address]);
1702  else
1703  return 0xff;
1704  }
1705  else
1706  return 0xff;
1707  case 0x70:
1708  if (gbCgbMode)
1709  return (0xf8 | register_SVBK);
1710  else
1711  return 0xff;
1712  case 0xff:
1713  return register_IE;
1714  }
1715  }
1716  // OAM not accessible during mode 2 & 3.
1717  if(((address >= 0xfe00) && (address<0xfea0)) &&
1718  ((gbLcdMode | gbLcdModeDelayed) &2))
1719  return 0xff;
1720  break;
1721  }
1722 
1723  if ((address >= 0xfea0) && (address < 0xff00))
1724  {
1725  if (gbHardware & 1)
1726  return ((((address + ((address >> 4) - 0xfea)) >> 2) & 1) ? 0x00 : 0xff );
1727  else if (gbHardware & 2)
1728  return gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address & 0x0fff];
1729  else if (gbHardware & 4)
1730  return ((((address + ((address >> 4) - 0xfea)) >> 2) & 1) ? 0xff : 0x00 );
1731  else if (gbHardware & 8)
1732  return ((address & 0xf0) |((address & 0xf0)>>4));
1733  }
1734 
1735  return gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address & 0x0fff];
1736 }
1737 
1738 u8 gbReadMemory(register u16 address)
1739 {
1740  if(gbCheatMap[address])
1741  return gbCheatRead(address);
1742 
1743 
1744  if(address < 0x8000)
1745  return gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address&0x0fff];
1746 
1747  if(address < 0xa000)
1748  {
1749  // A lot of 'ugly' checks... But only way to emulate this particular behaviour...
1750  if (((gbHardware & 0xa) && ((gbLcdModeDelayed !=3) || ((register_LY == 0) &&
1751  (gbScreenOn==false) && (register_LCDC & 0x80)) &&
1752  (gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed ==(GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS-GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS)))) ||
1753  ((gbHardware & 0x5) && (gbLcdModeDelayed !=3) &&
1754  ((gbLcdMode !=3) || ((register_LY == 0) && ((gbScreenOn==false) &&
1755  (register_LCDC & 0x80)) &&
1756  (gbLcdLYIncrementTicks ==(GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS-GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS))))))
1757  return gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address&0x0fff];
1758  return 0xff;
1759  }
1760 
1761  if ((address >= 0xe000) && (address < 0xfe00))
1762  address &= ~0x2000;
1763 
1764  if(address < 0xc000) {
1765 #ifndef FINAL_VERSION
1766  if(memorydebug) {
1767  log("Memory register read %04x PC=%04x\n",
1768  address,
1769  PC.W);
1770  }
1771 #endif
1772 
1773  // for the 2kb ram limit (fixes crash in shawu's story
1774  // but now its sram test fails, as the it expects 8kb and not 2kb...
1775  // So use the 'genericflashcard' option to fix it).
1776  if (address<=(0xa000+gbRamSizeMask))
1777  {
1778  if(mapperReadRAM)
1779  return mapperReadRAM(address);
1780  return gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address & 0x0fff];
1781  }
1782  return 0xff;
1783  }
1784 
1785  if(address >= 0xff00) {
1786  switch(address & 0x00ff) {
1787  case 0x00:
1788  {
1789  if(gbSgbMode) {
1790  gbSgbReadingController |= 4;
1791  gbSgbResetPacketState();
1792  }
1793 
1794  int b = gbMemory[0xff00];
1795 
1796  if((b & 0x30) == 0x20) {
1797  b &= 0xf0;
1798 
1799  int joy = 0;
1800  if(gbSgbMode && gbSgbMultiplayer) {
1801  switch(gbSgbNextController) {
1802  case 0x0f:
1803  joy = 0;
1804  break;
1805  case 0x0e:
1806  joy = 1;
1807  break;
1808  case 0x0d:
1809  joy = 2;
1810  break;
1811  case 0x0c:
1812  joy = 3;
1813  break;
1814  default:
1815  joy = 0;
1816  }
1817  }
1818  int joystate = gbJoymask[joy];
1819  if(!(joystate & 128))
1820  b |= 0x08;
1821  if(!(joystate & 64))
1822  b |= 0x04;
1823  if(!(joystate & 32))
1824  b |= 0x02;
1825  if(!(joystate & 16))
1826  b |= 0x01;
1827 
1828  gbMemory[0xff00] = b;
1829  } else if((b & 0x30) == 0x10) {
1830  b &= 0xf0;
1831 
1832  int joy = 0;
1833  if(gbSgbMode && gbSgbMultiplayer) {
1834  switch(gbSgbNextController) {
1835  case 0x0f:
1836  joy = 0;
1837  break;
1838  case 0x0e:
1839  joy = 1;
1840  break;
1841  case 0x0d:
1842  joy = 2;
1843  break;
1844  case 0x0c:
1845  joy = 3;
1846  break;
1847  default:
1848  joy = 0;
1849  }
1850  }
1851  int joystate = gbJoymask[joy];
1852  if(!(joystate & 8))
1853  b |= 0x08;
1854  if(!(joystate & 4))
1855  b |= 0x04;
1856  if(!(joystate & 2))
1857  b |= 0x02;
1858  if(!(joystate & 1))
1859  b |= 0x01;
1860 
1861  gbMemory[0xff00] = b;
1862  } else {
1863  if(gbSgbMode && gbSgbMultiplayer) {
1864  gbMemory[0xff00] = 0xf0 | gbSgbNextController;
1865  } else {
1866  gbMemory[0xff00] = 0xff;
1867  }
1868  }
1869  }
1870  return gbMemory[0xff00];
1871  break;
1872  case 0x01:
1873  return gbMemory[0xff01];
1874  case 0x02:
1875  return (gbMemory[0xff02]);
1876  case 0x04:
1877  return register_DIV;
1878  case 0x05:
1879  return register_TIMA;
1880  case 0x06:
1881  return register_TMA;
1882  case 0x07:
1883  return (0xf8 | register_TAC);
1884  case 0x0f:
1885  return (0xe0 | gbMemory[0xff0f]);
1886  case 0x30:
1887  case 0x31:
1888  case 0x32:
1889  case 0x33:
1890  case 0x34:
1891  case 0x35:
1892  case 0x36:
1893  case 0x37:
1894  case 0x38:
1895  case 0x39:
1896  case 0x3A:
1897  case 0x3B:
1898  case 0x3C:
1899  case 0x3D:
1900  case 0x3E:
1901  case 0x3F:
1902  if ((gbMemory[NR30] & 0x80) && (gbMemory[NR34] & 0x80))
1903  return 0xFF;
1904  else
1905  return gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address & 0x0fff];
1906  case 0x40:
1907  return register_LCDC;
1908  case 0x41:
1909  // This is a GB/C only bug (ie. not GBA/SP).
1910  if ((gbHardware & 7) && (gbLcdMode == 2) && (gbLcdModeDelayed == 1) && (!gbSpeed))
1911  return (0x80 | gbMemory[0xff41] & 0xFC);
1912  else
1913  return (0x80 | gbMemory[0xff41]);
1914  case 0x42:
1915  return register_SCY;
1916  case 0x43:
1917  return register_SCX;
1918  case 0x44:
1919  if (((gbHardware & 7) && ((gbLcdMode == 1) && (gbLcdTicks == 0x71))) ||
1920  (!(register_LCDC && 0x80)))
1921  return (0);
1922  else
1923  return register_LY;
1924  case 0x45:
1925  return register_LYC;
1926  case 0x46:
1927  return register_DMA;
1928  case 0x4a:
1929  return register_WY;
1930  case 0x4b:
1931  return register_WX;
1932  case 0x4f:
1933  return (0xfe | register_VBK);
1934  case 0x51:
1935  return register_HDMA1;
1936  case 0x52:
1937  return register_HDMA2;
1938  case 0x53:
1939  return register_HDMA3;
1940  case 0x54:
1941  return register_HDMA4;
1942  case 0x55:
1943  return register_HDMA5;
1944  case 0x68:
1945  case 0x6a:
1946  if (gbCgbMode)
1947  return (0x40 | gbMemory[address]);
1948  else
1949  return 0xc0;
1950  case 0x69:
1951  case 0x6b:
1952  if (gbCgbMode)
1953  {
1954  // No access to gbPalette during mode 3 (Color Panel Demo)
1955  if (((gbLcdModeDelayed != 3) && (!((gbLcdMode == 0) && (gbLcdTicks>=(GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS-gbSpritesTicks[299]-1)))) && (!gbSpeed)) ||
1956  (gbSpeed && ((gbLcdMode == 1) || (gbLcdMode == 2) ||
1957  ((gbLcdMode == 3) && (gbLcdTicks>(GBLCD_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS-2))) ||
1958  ((gbLcdMode == 0) && (gbLcdTicks<=(GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS-gbSpritesTicks[299]-2))))))
1959  return (gbMemory[address]);
1960  else
1961  return 0xff;
1962  }
1963  else
1964  return 0xff;
1965  case 0x70:
1966  if (gbCgbMode)
1967  return (0xf8 | register_SVBK);
1968  else
1969  return 0xff;
1970  case 0xff:
1971  return register_IE;
1972  }
1973  }
1974  // OAM not accessible during mode 2 & 3.
1975  if(((address >= 0xfe00) && (address<0xfea0)) &&
1976  (((gbLcdMode | gbLcdModeDelayed) &2) &&
1977  (!(gbSpeed && (gbHardware & 0x2) && !(gbLcdModeDelayed & 2) && (gbLcdMode == 2))) ||
1978  (gbSpeed && (gbHardware & 0x2) && (gbLcdModeDelayed == 0) && (gbLcdTicksDelayed == (GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS-gbSpritesTicks[299])))))
1979  return 0xff;
1980 
1981  if ((address >= 0xfea0) && (address < 0xff00))
1982  {
1983  if (gbHardware & 1)
1984  return ((((address + ((address >> 4) - 0xfea)) >> 2) & 1) ? 0x00 : 0xff );
1985  else if (gbHardware & 2)
1986  return gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address & 0x0fff];
1987  else if (gbHardware & 4)
1988  return ((((address + ((address >> 4) - 0xfea)) >> 2) & 1) ? 0xff : 0x00 );
1989  else if (gbHardware & 8)
1990  return ((address & 0xf0) |((address & 0xf0)>>4));
1991  }
1992 
1993  return gbMemoryMap[address>>12][address & 0x0fff];
1994 }
1995 
1996 void gbVblank_interrupt()
1997 {
1998  gbCheatWrite(false); // Emulates GS codes.
1999  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF &= 0xfe;
2000  gbWriteMemory(--SP.W, PC.B.B1);
2001  gbWriteMemory(--SP.W, PC.B.B0);
2002  PC.W = 0x40;
2003 }
2004

2008  gbWriteMemory(--SP.W, PC.B.B1);
2009  gbWriteMemory(--SP.W, PC.B.B0);
2010  PC.W = 0x48;
2011 }

2017  gbWriteMemory(--SP.W, PC.B.B0);
2018  PC.W = 0x50;

2033  gbWriteMemory(--SP.W, PC.B.B0);

2037 void gbSpeedSwitch()
2038 {
2039  gbBlackScreen = true;
2040  if(gbSpeed == 0) {
2041  gbSpeed = 1;
2042  GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS = 51 * 2;
2043  GBLCD_MODE_1_CLOCK_TICKS = 1140 * 2;
2044  GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS = 20 * 2;
2045  GBLCD_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS = 43 * 2;
2046  GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS = 114 * 2;
2047  GBDIV_CLOCK_TICKS = 64;
2048  GBTIMER_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS = 256;
2049  GBTIMER_MODE_1_CLOCK_TICKS = 4;
2050  GBTIMER_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS = 16;
2051  GBTIMER_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS = 64;
2052  GBSERIAL_CLOCK_TICKS = 128 * 2;
2053  gbLcdTicks *= 2;
2054  gbLcdTicksDelayed *=2;
2055  gbLcdTicksDelayed--;
2056  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks *= 2;
2057  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed *= 2;
2058  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed--;
2059  gbSerialTicks *= 2;
2060  SOUND_CLOCK_TICKS = soundQuality * 24 * 2;
2061  soundTicks *= 2;
2062  gbLine99Ticks = 3;
2063  } else {
2064  gbSpeed = 0;
2065  GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS = 51;
2066  GBLCD_MODE_1_CLOCK_TICKS = 1140;
2067  GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS = 20;
2068  GBLCD_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS = 43;
2069  GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS = 114;
2070  GBDIV_CLOCK_TICKS = 64;
2071  GBTIMER_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS = 256;
2072  GBTIMER_MODE_1_CLOCK_TICKS = 4;
2073  GBTIMER_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS = 16;
2074  GBTIMER_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS = 64;
2075  GBSERIAL_CLOCK_TICKS = 128;
2076  gbLcdTicks >>= 1;
2077  gbLcdTicksDelayed++;
2078  gbLcdTicksDelayed >>=1;
2079  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks >>= 1;
2080  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed++;
2081  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed >>= 1;
2082  gbSerialTicks /= 2;
2083  SOUND_CLOCK_TICKS = soundQuality * 24;
2084  soundTicks /= 2;
2085  gbLine99Ticks = 1;
2086  if (gbHardware & 8)
2087  gbLine99Ticks++;
2088  }
2089  gbDmaTicks += (134)*GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS + (37<<(gbSpeed ? 1 : 0));
2090 }
2091 
2092 bool CPUIsGBBios(const char * file)
2093 {
2094  if(strlen(file) > 4) {
2095  const char * p = strrchr(file,'.');
2096 
2097  if(p != NULL) {
2098  if(_stricmp(p, ".gb") == 0)
2099  return true;
2100  if(_stricmp(p, ".bin") == 0)
2101  return true;
2102  if(_stricmp(p, ".bios") == 0)
2103  return true;
2104  }
2105  }
2106 
2107  return false;
2108 }

2110 void gbCPUInit(const char *biosFileName, bool useBiosFile)
2111 {
2112  useBios = false;
2113  if (useBiosFile)
2114  {
2115  int size = 0x100;
2116  if(utilLoad(biosFileName,
2117  CPUIsGBBios,
2118  bios,
2119  size)) {
2120  if(size == 0x100)
2121  useBios = true;
2122  else
2123  systemMessage(MSG_INVALID_BIOS_FILE_SIZE, N_("Invalid BOOTROM file size"));
2124  }
2125  }
2126 }
2127 
2128 void gbGetHardwareType()
2129 {
2130  gbCgbMode = 0;
2131  gbSgbMode = 0;
2132  if(gbRom[0x143] & 0x80) {
2133  if((gbEmulatorType == 0) ||
2134  gbEmulatorType == 1 ||
2135  gbEmulatorType == 4) {
2136  gbCgbMode = 1;
2137  }
2138  }
2139 
2140  if((gbCgbMode == 0 ) && (gbRom[0x146] == 0x03)) {
2141  if(gbEmulatorType == 0 ||
2142  gbEmulatorType == 2 ||
2143  gbEmulatorType == 5)
2144  gbSgbMode = 1;
2145  }
2146 
2147  gbHardware = 1; // GB
2148  if (((gbCgbMode == 1) && (gbEmulatorType == 0)) || (gbEmulatorType == 1))
2149  gbHardware = 2; // GBC
2150  else if (((gbSgbMode == 1) && (gbEmulatorType == 0)) || (gbEmulatorType == 2) || (gbEmulatorType == 5))
2151  gbHardware = 4; // SGB(2)
2152  else if (gbEmulatorType == 4)
2153  gbHardware = 8; // GBA
2154 
2155  gbGBCColorType = 0;
2156  if (gbHardware & 8) // If GBA is selected, choose the GBA default settings.
2157  gbGBCColorType = 2; // (0 = GBC, 1 = GBA, 2 = GBASP)
2158 }
2159 
2160 void gbReset()
2161 {
2162  gbGetHardwareType();
2163 
2164  oldRegister_WY = 146;
2165  gbInterruptLaunched = 0;
2166 
2167  if(gbCgbMode == 1) {
2168  if (gbVram == NULL)
2169  gbVram = (u8 *)malloc(0x4000);
2170  if (gbWram == NULL)
2171  gbWram = (u8 *)malloc(0x8000);
2172  memset(gbVram,0,0x4000);
2173  memset(gbPalette,0, 2*128);
2174  }
2175  else
2176  {
2177  if(gbVram != NULL) {
2178  free(gbVram);
2179  gbVram = NULL;
2180  }
2181  if(gbWram != NULL) {
2182  free(gbWram);
2183  gbWram = NULL;
2184  }
2185  }
2186 
2187  gbLYChangeHappened = false;
2188  gbLCDChangeHappened = false;
2189  gbBlackScreen = false;
2190  gbInterruptWait = 0;
2191  gbDmaTicks = 0;
2192  clockTicks = 0;
2193 
2194  if(gbSpeed) {
2195  gbSpeedSwitch();
2196  gbMemory[0xff4d] = 0;
2197  }
2198 
2199  // clean Wram
2200  // This kinda emulates the startup state of Wram on GB/C (not very accurate,
2201  // but way closer to the reality than filling it with 00es or FFes).
2202  // On GBA/GBASP, it's kinda filled with random data.
2203  // In all cases, most of the 2nd bank is filled with 00s.
2204  // The starting data are important for some 'buggy' games, like Buster Brothers or
2205  // Karamuchou ha Oosawagi!.
2206  if (gbMemory != NULL)
2207  {
2208  memset(gbMemory,0xff, 65536);
2209  for (int temp = 0xC000; temp < 0xE000; temp++)
2210  if ((temp & 0x8) ^((temp & 0x800)>>8))
2211  {
2212  if ((gbHardware & 0x02) && (gbGBCColorType == 0))
2213  gbMemory[temp] = 0x0;
2214  else
2215  gbMemory[temp] = 0x0f;
2216  }
2217 
2218  else
2219  gbMemory[temp] = 0xff;
2220  }
2221 
2222 
2223 
2224  // clean LineBuffer
2225  if (gbLineBuffer != NULL)
2226  memset(gbLineBuffer, 0, sizeof(gbLineBuffer));
2227  // clean Pix
2228  if (pix != NULL)
2229  memset(pix, 0, sizeof(pix));
2230  // clean Vram
2231  if (gbVram != NULL)
2232  memset(gbVram, 0, 0x4000);
2233  // clean Wram 2
2234  // This kinda emulates the startup state of Wram on GBC (not very accurate,
2235  // but way closer to the reality than filling it with 00es or FFes).
2236  // On GBA/GBASP, it's kinda filled with random data.
2237  // In all cases, most of the 2nd bank is filled with 00s.
2238  // The starting data are important for some 'buggy' games, like Buster Brothers or
2239  // Karamuchou ha Oosawagi!
2240  if (gbWram != NULL)
2241  {
2242  for (int i = 0; i<8; i++)
2243  if (i != 2)
2244  memcpy ((u16 *)(gbWram+i*0x1000), (u16 *)(gbMemory+0xC000), 0x1000);
2245  }
2246 
2247  memset(gbSCYLine,0,sizeof(gbSCYLine));
2248  memset(gbSCXLine,0,sizeof(gbSCXLine));
2249  memset(gbBgpLine,0xfc,sizeof(gbBgpLine));
2250  if (gbHardware & 5)
2251  {
2252  memset(gbObp0Line,0xff,sizeof(gbObp0Line));
2253  memset(gbObp1Line,0xff,sizeof(gbObp1Line));
2254  }
2255  else
2256  {
2257  memset(gbObp0Line,0x0,sizeof(gbObp0Line));
2258  memset(gbObp1Line,0x0,sizeof(gbObp1Line));
2259  }
2260  memset(gbSpritesTicks,0x0,sizeof(gbSpritesTicks));
2261 
2262  SP.W = 0xfffe;
2263  AF.W = 0x01b0;
2264  BC.W = 0x0013;
2265  DE.W = 0x00d8;
2266  HL.W = 0x014d;
2267  PC.W = 0x0100;
2268  IFF = 0;
2269  gbInt48Signal = 0;
2270 
2271  register_TIMA = 0;
2272  register_TMA = 0;
2273  register_TAC = 0;
2274  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF = 1;
2275  gbMemory[0xff40] = register_LCDC = 0x91;
2276  gbMemory[0xff47] = 0xfc;
2277 
2278  if (gbCgbMode)
2279  gbMemory[0xff4d] = 0x7e;
2280  else
2281  gbMemory[0xff4d] = 0xff;
2282 
2283  if (!gbCgbMode)
2284  gbMemory[0xff70] = gbMemory[0xff74] = 0xff;
2285 
2286  if (gbCgbMode)
2287  gbMemory[0xff56] = 0x3e;
2288  else
2289  gbMemory[0xff56] = 0xff;
2290 
2291  register_SCY = 0;
2292  register_SCX = 0;
2293  register_LYC = 0;
2294  register_DMA = 0xff;
2295  register_WY = 0;
2296  register_WX = 0;
2297  register_VBK = 0;
2298  register_HDMA1 = 0xff;
2299  register_HDMA2 = 0xff;
2300  register_HDMA3 = 0xff;
2301  register_HDMA4 = 0xff;
2302  register_HDMA5 = 0xff;
2303  register_SVBK = 0;
2304  register_IE = 0;
2305 
2306  if (gbCgbMode)
2307  gbMemory[0xff02] = 0x7c;
2308  else
2309  gbMemory[0xff02] = 0x7e;
2310 
2311  gbMemory[0xff03] = 0xff;
2312  int i;
2313  for (i = 0x8; i<0xf; i++)
2314  gbMemory[0xff00+i] = 0xff;
2315 
2316  gbMemory[0xff13] = 0xff;
2317  gbMemory[0xff15] = 0xff;
2318  gbMemory[0xff18] = 0xff;
2319  gbMemory[0xff1d] = 0xff;
2320  gbMemory[0xff1f] = 0xff;
2321 
2322  for (i = 0x27; i<0x30; i++)
2323  gbMemory[0xff00+i] = 0xff;
2324 
2325  gbMemory[0xff4c] = 0xff;
2326  gbMemory[0xff4e] = 0xff;
2327  gbMemory[0xff50] = 0xff;
2328 
2329  for (i = 0x57; i<0x68; i++)
2330  gbMemory[0xff00+i] = 0xff;
2331 
2332  for (i = 0x5d; i<0x70; i++)
2333  gbMemory[0xff00+i] = 0xff;
2334 
2335  gbMemory[0xff71] = 0xff;
2336 
2337  for (i = 0x78; i<0x80; i++)
2338  gbMemory[0xff00+i] = 0xff;
2339 
2340  if (gbHardware & 0xa)
2341  {
2342 
2343  if (gbHardware & 2)
2344  {
2345  AF.W = 0x1180;
2346  BC.W = 0x0000;
2347  }
2348  else
2349  {
2350  AF.W = 0x1100;
2351  BC.W = 0x0100; // GBA/SP have B = 0x01 (which means GBC & GBA/SP bootrom are different !)
2352  }
2353 
2354  gbMemory[0xff26] = 0xf1;
2355  if (gbCgbMode)
2356  {
2357 
2358  gbMemory[0xff31] = 0xff;
2359  gbMemory[0xff33] = 0xff;
2360  gbMemory[0xff35] = 0xff;
2361  gbMemory[0xff37] = 0xff;
2362  gbMemory[0xff39] = 0xff;
2363  gbMemory[0xff3b] = 0xff;
2364  gbMemory[0xff3d] = 0xff;
2365 
2366  gbMemory[0xff44] = register_LY = 0x90;
2367  gbDivTicks = 0x19 + ((gbHardware & 2) >> 1);
2368  gbInternalTimer = 0x58 + ((gbHardware & 2) >> 1);
2369  gbLcdTicks = GBLCD_MODE_1_CLOCK_TICKS -
2370  (register_LY-0x8F)*GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS + 72 + ((gbHardware & 2) >> 1);
2371  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks = 72 + ((gbHardware & 2) >> 1);
2372  gbMemory[0xff04] = register_DIV = 0x1E;
2373  }
2374  else
2375  {
2376  gbMemory[0xff44] = register_LY = 0x94;
2377  gbDivTicks = 0x22 + ((gbHardware & 2) >> 1);
2378  gbInternalTimer = 0x61 + ((gbHardware & 2) >> 1);
2379  gbLcdTicks = GBLCD_MODE_1_CLOCK_TICKS -
2380  (register_LY-0x8F)*GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS + 25 + ((gbHardware & 2) >> 1);
2381  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks = 25 + ((gbHardware & 2) >> 1);
2382  gbMemory[0xff04] = register_DIV = 0x26;
2383  }
2384 
2385 
2386  DE.W = 0xff56;
2387  HL.W = 0x000d;
2388 
2389  register_HDMA5 = 0xff;
2390  gbMemory[0xff68] = 0xc0;
2391  gbMemory[0xff6a] = 0xc0;
2392 
2393 
2394  gbMemory[0xff41] = register_STAT = 0x81;
2395  gbLcdMode = 1;
2396  }
2397  else
2398  {
2399  if (gbHardware & 4)
2400  {
2401  if(gbEmulatorType == 5)
2402  AF.W = 0xffb0;
2403  else
2404  AF.W = 0x01b0;
2405  BC.W = 0x0013;
2406  DE.W = 0x00d8;
2407  HL.W = 0x014d;
2408  }
2409  gbDivTicks = 14;
2410  gbInternalTimer = gbDivTicks--;
2411  gbMemory[0xff04] = register_DIV = 0xAB;
2412  gbMemory[0xff41] = register_STAT = 0x85;
2413  gbMemory[0xff44] = register_LY = 0x00;
2414  gbLcdTicks = 15;
2415  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks = 114+gbLcdTicks;
2416  gbLcdMode = 1;
2417 
2418  // used for the handling of the gb Boot Rom
2419  if ((gbHardware & 5) && (bios != NULL) && useBios && !skipBios)
2420  {
2421  memcpy ((u8 *)(gbMemory), (u8 *)(gbRom), 0x1000);
2422  memcpy ((u8 *)(gbMemory), (u8 *)(bios), 0x100);
2423  gbWhiteScreen = 0;
2424 
2425  gbInternalTimer = 0x3e;
2426  gbDivTicks = 0x3f;
2427  gbMemory[0xff04] = register_DIV = 0x00;
2428  PC.W = 0x0000;
2429  register_LCDC = 0x11;
2430  gbScreenOn = false;
2431  gbLcdTicks = 0;
2432  gbLcdMode = 0;
2433  gbLcdModeDelayed = 0;
2434  gbMemory[0xff41] = register_STAT &= 0xfc;
2435  gbInt48Signal = 0;
2436  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks = GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS;
2437  }
2438  }
2439 
2440  gbLine99Ticks = 1;
2441  if (gbHardware & 8)
2442  gbLine99Ticks++;
2443 
2444  gbLcdModeDelayed = gbLcdMode;
2445  gbLcdTicksDelayed = gbLcdTicks+1;
2446  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed = gbLcdLYIncrementTicks+1;
2447 
2448 
2449  gbTimerModeChange = false;
2450  gbTimerOnChange = false;
2451  gbTimerOn = false;
2452 
2453  if(gbCgbMode) {
2454  for (int i = 0; i<0x20; i++)
2455  gbPalette[i] = 0x7fff;
2456 
2457  // This is just to show that the starting values of the OBJ palettes are different
2458  // between the 3 consoles, and that they 'kinda' stay the same at each reset
2459  // (they can slightly change, somehow (randomly?)).
2460  // You can check the effects of gbGBCColorType on the "Vila Caldan Color" gbc demo.
2461  // Note that you could also check the Div register to check on which system the game
2462  // is running (GB,GBC and GBA(SP) have different startup values).
2463  // Unfortunatly, I don't have any SGB system, so I can't get their starting values.
2464 
2465  if (gbGBCColorType == 0) // GBC Hardware

2859 bool gbReadSaveMBC1(const char * name)
2860 {
2861  if (gbRam)
2862  {
2863  gzFile gzFile = gzopen(name, "rb");
2864 
2865  if(gzFile == NULL) {
2866  return false;
2867  }
2868 
2869  int read = gzread(gzFile,
2870  gbRam,
2871  (gbRamSizeMask+1));
2872 
2873  if(read != (gbRamSizeMask+1)) {
2874  systemMessage(MSG_FAILED_TO_READ_SGM,
2875  N_("Battery file's size incompatible with the rom settings %s (%d).\nWarning : save of the battery file is now disabled !"), name, read);
2876  gzclose(gzFile);
2877  gbBatteryError = true;
2878  return false;
2879  }
2880 
2881  // Also checks if the battery file it bigger than gbRamSizeMask+1 !
2882  u8 data[1];
2883  data[0] = 0;
2884 
2885  read = gzread(gzFile,
2886  data,
2887  1);
2888  if(read >0) {
2889  systemMessage(MSG_FAILED_TO_READ_SGM,
2890  N_("Battery file's size incompatible with the rom settings %s (%d).\nWarning : save of the battery file is now disabled !"), name, read);
2891  gzclose(gzFile);
2892  gbBatteryError = true;
2893  return false;
2894  }
2895 
2896  gzclose(gzFile);
2897  return true;
2898  }
2899  else
2900  return false;
2901 }

2950 bool gbReadSaveMBC3(const char * name)
2951 {
2952  gzFile gzFile = gzopen(name, "rb");
2953 
2954  if(gzFile == NULL) {
2955  return false;
2956  }
2957 
2958  int read = 0;
2959 
2960  if (gbRam)
2961  read = gzread(gzFile,
2962  gbRam,
2963  (gbRamSizeMask+1));
2964  else
2965  read = (gbRamSizeMask+1);
2966 
2967 
2968  bool res = true;
2969 
2970  if(read != (gbRamSizeMask+1)) {
2971  systemMessage(MSG_FAILED_TO_READ_SGM,
2972  N_("Battery file's size incompatible with the rom settings %s (%d).\nWarning : save of the battery file is now disabled !"), name, read);
2973  gbBatteryError = true;
2974  res = false;
2975  } else if ((gbRomType == 0xf) || (gbRomType == 0x10)){
2976  read = gzread(gzFile,
2977  &gbDataMBC3.mapperSeconds,
2978  sizeof(int)*10 + sizeof(time_t));
2979 
2980  if(read != (sizeof(int)*10 + sizeof(time_t)) && read != 0) {
2981  systemMessage(MSG_FAILED_TO_READ_RTC,N_("Failed to read RTC from save game %s (continuing)"),
2982  name);
2983  res = false;
2984  }
2985  else if (read == 0)
2986  {
2987  systemMessage(MSG_FAILED_TO_READ_RTC,N_("Failed to read RTC from save game %s (continuing)"),
2988  name);
2989  res = false;
2990  }
2991  else
2992  {
2993  // Also checks if the battery file it bigger than gbRamSizeMask+1+RTC !
2994  u8 data[1];
2995  data[0] = 0;
2996 
2997  read = gzread(gzFile,
2998  data,
2999  1);
3000  if(read >0) {
3001  systemMessage(MSG_FAILED_TO_READ_SGM,
3002  N_("Battery file's size incompatible with the rom settings %s (%d).\nWarning : save of the battery file is now disabled !"), name, read);
3003  gbBatteryError = true;
3004  res = false;
3005  }
3006  }
3007  }
3008 
3009  gzclose(gzFile);
3010  return res;
3011 }

3095  }
3096 
3097  fclose(file);
3098  return true;
3099  }

3250  break;

3253  break;

3275 bool gbReadBatteryFile(const char *file)
3276 {
3277  bool res = false;
3278  if(gbBattery) {
3279  switch(gbRomType) {
3280  case 0x03:
3281  res = gbReadSaveMBC1(file);
3282  break;
3283  case 0x06:
3284  res = gbReadSaveMBC2(file);
3285  break;
3286  case 0x0d:
3287  res = gbReadSaveMMM01(file);
3288  break;
3289  case 0x0f:
3290  case 0x10:
3291  if(!gbReadSaveMBC3(file)) {
3292  time(&gbDataMBC3.mapperLastTime);
3293  struct tm *lt;
3294  lt = localtime(&gbDataMBC3.mapperLastTime);
3295  gbDataMBC3.mapperSeconds = lt->tm_sec;
3296  gbDataMBC3.mapperMinutes = lt->tm_min;
3297  gbDataMBC3.mapperHours = lt->tm_hour;
3298  gbDataMBC3.mapperDays = lt->tm_yday & 255;
3299  gbDataMBC3.mapperControl = (gbDataMBC3.mapperControl & 0xfe) |
3300  (lt->tm_yday > 255 ? 1: 0);
3301  res = false;
3302  break;
3303  }
3304  res = true;
3305  break;
3306  case 0x13:
3307  case 0xfc:
3308  res = gbReadSaveMBC3(file);
3309  case 0x1b:
3310  case 0x1e:
3311  res = gbReadSaveMBC5(file);
3312  break;
3313  case 0x22:
3314  res = gbReadSaveMBC7(file);
3315  case 0xfd:
3316  if(!gbReadSaveTAMA5(file)) {
3317  u8 gbDaysinMonth [12] = { 31, 28, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31, 31, 30, 31, 30, 31};
3318  time(&gbDataTAMA5.mapperLastTime);
3319  struct tm *lt;
3320  lt = localtime(&gbDataTAMA5.mapperLastTime);
3321  gbDataTAMA5.mapperSeconds = lt->tm_sec;
3322  gbDataTAMA5.mapperMinutes = lt->tm_min;
3323  gbDataTAMA5.mapperHours = lt->tm_hour;
3324  gbDataTAMA5.mapperDays = 1;
3325  gbDataTAMA5.mapperMonths = 1;
3326  gbDataTAMA5.mapperYears = 1970;
3327  int days = lt->tm_yday+365*3;
3328  while (days)
3329  {
3330  gbDataTAMA5.mapperDays++;
3331  days--;
3332  if (gbDataTAMA5.mapperDays>gbDaysinMonth[gbDataTAMA5.mapperMonths-1])
3333  {
3334  gbDataTAMA5.mapperDays = 1;
3335  gbDataTAMA5.mapperMonths++;
3336  if (gbDataTAMA5.mapperMonths>12)
3337  {
3338  gbDataTAMA5.mapperMonths = 1;
3339  gbDataTAMA5.mapperYears++;
3340  if ((gbDataTAMA5.mapperYears & 3) == 0)
3341  gbDaysinMonth[1] = 29;
3342  else
3343  gbDaysinMonth[1] = 28;
3344  }
3345  }
3346  }
3347  gbDataTAMA5.mapperControl = (gbDataTAMA5.mapperControl & 0xfe) |
3348  (lt->tm_yday > 255 ? 1: 0);
3349  res = false;
3350  break;
3351  }
3352  res = true;
3353  break;
3354  case 0xff:
3355  res = gbReadSaveMBC1(file);
3356  break;
3357  }
3358  }
3359  systemSaveUpdateCounter = SYSTEM_SAVE_NOT_UPDATED;
3360  return res;
3361 }

3363 bool gbReadGSASnapshot(const char *fileName)
3364 {
3365  FILE *file = fopen(fileName, "rb");
3366 
3367  if(!file) {
3368  systemMessage(MSG_CANNOT_OPEN_FILE, N_("Cannot open file %s"), fileName);
3369  return false;
3370  }
3371 
3372  fseek(file, 0x4, SEEK_SET);
3373  char buffer[16];
3374  char buffer2[16];
3375  fread(buffer, 1, 15, file);
3376  buffer[15] = 0;
3377  memcpy(buffer2, &gbRom[0x134], 15);
3378  buffer2[15] = 0;
3379  if(memcmp(buffer, buffer2, 15)) {
3380  systemMessage(MSG_CANNOT_IMPORT_SNAPSHOT_FOR,
3381  N_("Cannot import snapshot for %s. Current game is %s"),
3382  buffer,
3383  buffer2);
3384  fclose(file);
3385  return false;
3386  }
3387  fseek(file, 0x13, SEEK_SET);
3388  size_t read = 0;
3389  int toRead = 0;
3390  switch(gbRomType) {
3391  case 0x03:
3392  case 0x0f:
3393  case 0x10:
3394  case 0x13:
3395  case 0x1b:
3396  case 0x1e:
3397  case 0xff:
3398  read = fread(gbRam, 1, (gbRamSizeMask+1), file);
3399  toRead = (gbRamSizeMask+1);
3400  break;
3401  case 0x06:
3402  case 0x22:
3403  read = fread(&gbMemory[0xa000],1,256,file);
3404  toRead = 256;
3405  break;
3406  default:
3407  systemMessage(MSG_UNSUPPORTED_SNAPSHOT_FILE,
3408  N_("Unsupported snapshot file %s"),
3409  fileName);
3410  fclose(file);
3411  return false;
3412  }
3413  fclose(file);
3414  gbReset();
3415  return true;
3416 }

3595 static bool gbReadSaveState(gzFile gzFile)
3596 {
3597  int version = utilReadInt(gzFile);
3598 
3599  if(version > GBSAVE_GAME_VERSION || version < 0) {
3600  systemMessage(MSG_UNSUPPORTED_VB_SGM,
3601  N_("Unsupported VisualBoy save game version %d"), version);
3602  return false;
3603  }
3604 
3605  u8 romname[20];
3606 
3607  utilGzRead(gzFile, romname, 15);
3608 
3609  if(memcmp(&gbRom[0x134], romname, 15) != 0) {
3610  systemMessage(MSG_CANNOT_LOAD_SGM_FOR,
3611  N_("Cannot load save game for %s. Playing %s"),
3612  romname, &gbRom[0x134]);
3613  return false;
3614  }
3615 
3616 
3617  bool ub = false;
3618  bool ib = false;
3619 
3620  if (version >= 11)
3621  {
3622  ub = utilReadInt(gzFile) ? true : false;
3623  ib = utilReadInt(gzFile) ? true : false;
3624 
3625  if((ub != useBios) && (ib)) {
3626  if(useBios)
3627  systemMessage(MSG_SAVE_GAME_NOT_USING_BIOS,
3628  N_("Save game is not using the BIOS files"));
3629  else
3630  systemMessage(MSG_SAVE_GAME_USING_BIOS,
3631  N_("Save game is using the BIOS file"));
3632  return false;
3633  }
3634  }
3635 
3636  gbReset();
3637 
3638  inBios = ib;
3639 
3640  utilReadData(gzFile, gbSaveGameStruct);
3641 
3642 
3643  // Correct crash when loading color gameboy save in regular gameboy type.
3644  if (!gbCgbMode)
3645  {
3646  if(gbVram != NULL) {
3647  free(gbVram);
3648  gbVram = NULL;
3649  }
3650  if(gbWram != NULL) {
3651  free(gbWram);
3652  gbWram = NULL;
3653  }
3654  }
3655  else
3656  {
3657  if(gbVram == NULL)
3658  gbVram = (u8 *)malloc(0x4000);
3659  if(gbWram == NULL)
3660  gbWram = (u8 *)malloc(0x8000);
3661  memset(gbVram,0,0x4000);
3662  memset(gbPalette,0, 2*128);
3663  }
3664 
3665 
3666 
3667  if(version >= GBSAVE_GAME_VERSION_7) {
3668  utilGzRead(gzFile, &IFF, 2);
3669  }
3670 
3671  if(gbSgbMode) {
3672  gbSgbReadGame(gzFile, version);
3673  } else {
3674  gbSgbMask = 0; // loading a game at the wrong time causes no display
3675  }
3676  if (version<11)
3677  utilGzRead(gzFile, &gbDataMBC1, sizeof(gbDataMBC1) - sizeof(int));
3678  else
3679  utilGzRead(gzFile, &gbDataMBC1, sizeof(gbDataMBC1));
3680  utilGzRead(gzFile, &gbDataMBC2, sizeof(gbDataMBC2));
3681  if(version < GBSAVE_GAME_VERSION_4)
3682  // prior to version 4, there was no adjustment for the time the game
3683  // was last played, so we have less to read. This needs update if the
3684  // structure changes again.
3685  utilGzRead(gzFile, &gbDataMBC3, sizeof(gbDataMBC3)-sizeof(time_t));
3686  else
3687  utilGzRead(gzFile, &gbDataMBC3, sizeof(gbDataMBC3));
3688  utilGzRead(gzFile, &gbDataMBC5, sizeof(gbDataMBC5));
3689  utilGzRead(gzFile, &gbDataHuC1, sizeof(gbDataHuC1));
3690  utilGzRead(gzFile, &gbDataHuC3, sizeof(gbDataHuC3));
3691  if (version>=11)
3692  {
3693  utilGzRead(gzFile, &gbDataTAMA5, sizeof(gbDataTAMA5));
3694  if (gbTAMA5ram != NULL)
3695  utilGzRead(gzFile, gbTAMA5ram, gbTAMA5ramSize);
3696  utilGzRead(gzFile, &gbDataMMM01, sizeof(gbDataMMM01));
3697  }
3698 
3699  if(version < GBSAVE_GAME_VERSION_5) {
3700  utilGzRead(gzFile, pix, 256*224*sizeof(u16));
3701  }
3702  memset(pix, 0, 257*226*sizeof(u32));
3703 
3704  if(version < GBSAVE_GAME_VERSION_6) {

4057 bool gbUpdateSizes()
4058 {
4059  if(gbRom[0x148] > 8) {
4060  systemMessage(MSG_UNSUPPORTED_ROM_SIZE,
4061  N_("Unsupported rom size %02x"), gbRom[0x148]);
4062  return false;
4063  }
4064 
4065  if(gbRomSize < gbRomSizes[gbRom[0x148]]) {
4066  gbRom = (u8 *)realloc(gbRom, gbRomSizes[gbRom[0x148]]);
4067  for (int i = gbRomSize; i<gbRomSizes[gbRom[0x148]]; i++)
4068  gbRom[i] = 0x00; // Not sure if it's 0x00, 0xff or random data...
4069  }
4070  // (it's in the case a cart is 'lying' on its size.
4071  else if ((gbRomSize>gbRomSizes[gbRom[0x148]]) && (genericflashcardEnable))
4072  {
4073  gbRomSize = gbRomSize>>16;
4074  gbRom[0x148] = 0;
4075  if (gbRomSize)
4076  {
4077  while (!((gbRomSize & 1) || (gbRom[0x148] == 7)))
4078  {
4079  gbRom[0x148]++;
4080  gbRomSize>>=1;
4081  }
4082  gbRom[0x148]++;
4083  }
4084  gbRom = (u8 *)realloc(gbRom, gbRomSizes[gbRom[0x148]]);
4085  }
4086  gbRomSize = gbRomSizes[gbRom[0x148]];
4087  gbRomSizeMask = gbRomSizesMasks[gbRom[0x148]];
4088 
4089 
4090  // The 'genericflashcard' option allows some PD to work.
4091  // However, the setting is dangerous (if you let in enabled
4092  // and play a normal game, it might just break everything).
4093  // That's why it is not saved in the emulator options.
4094  // Also I added some checks in VBA to make sure your saves will not be
4095  // overwritten if you wrongly enable this option for a game
4096  // you already played (and vice-versa, ie. if you forgot to
4097  // enable the option for a game you played with it enabled, like Shawu Story).
4098  u8 ramsize = genericflashcardEnable ? 5 : gbRom[0x149];
4099  gbRom[0x149] = ramsize;
4100 
4101  if ((gbRom[2] == 0x6D) && (gbRom[5] == 0x47) && (gbRom[6] == 0x65) && (gbRom[7] == 0x6E) &&
4102  (gbRom[8] == 0x69) && (gbRom[9] == 0x65) && (gbRom[0xA] == 0x28) && (gbRom[0xB] == 0x54))
4103  {
4104  gbCheatingDevice = 1; // GameGenie
4105  for (int i = 0; i < 0x20; i++) // Cleans GG hardware registers
4106  gbRom[0x4000+i] = 0;
4107  }
4108  else if (((gbRom[0x104] == 0x44) && (gbRom[0x156] == 0xEA) && (gbRom[0x158] == 0x7F) &&
4109  (gbRom[0x159] == 0xEA) && (gbRom[0x15B] == 0x7F)) || ((gbRom[0x165] == 0x3E) &&
4110  (gbRom[0x166] == 0xD9) && (gbRom[0x16D] == 0xE1) && (gbRom[0x16E] == 0x7F)))
4111  gbCheatingDevice = 2; // GameShark
4112  else gbCheatingDevice = 0;
4113 
4114  if(ramsize > 5) {
4115  systemMessage(MSG_UNSUPPORTED_RAM_SIZE,
4116  N_("Unsupported ram size %02x"), gbRom[0x149]);
4117  return false;
4118  }
4119 
4120  gbRamSize = gbRamSizes[ramsize];
4121  gbRamSizeMask = gbRamSizesMasks[ramsize];
4122 
4123  if(gbRamSize) {
4124  gbRam = (u8 *)malloc(gbRamSize);
4125  memset(gbRam, 0xff, gbRamSize);
4126  }
4127 
4128 
4129  gbRomType = gbRom[0x147];
4130  if (genericflashcardEnable)
4131  {
4132  /*if (gbRomType<2)
4133  gbRomType =3;
4134  else if ((gbRomType == 0xc) || (gbRomType == 0xf) || (gbRomType == 0x12) ||
4135  (gbRomType == 0x16) || (gbRomType == 0x1a) || (gbRomType == 0x1d))
4136  gbRomType++;
4137  else if ((gbRomType == 0xb) || (gbRomType == 0x11) || (gbRomType == 0x15) ||
4138  (gbRomType == 0x19) || (gbRomType == 0x1c))
4139  gbRomType+=2;
4140  else if ((gbRomType == 0x5) || (gbRomType == 0x6))
4141  gbRomType = 0x1a;*/
4142  gbRomType = 0x1b;
4143  }
4144  else if (gbCheatingDevice == 1)
4145  gbRomType = 0x55;
4146  else if (gbCheatingDevice == 2)
4147  gbRomType = 0x56;
4148 
4149  gbRom[0x147] = gbRomType;
4150 
4151  mapperReadRAM = NULL;
4152 
4153  switch(gbRomType) {
4154  case 0x00:
4155  case 0x01:
4156  case 0x02:
4157  case 0x03:
4158  case 0x08:
4159  case 0x09:
4160  // MBC 1
4161  mapper = mapperMBC1ROM;
4162  mapperRAM = mapperMBC1RAM;
4163  mapperReadRAM = mapperMBC1ReadRAM;
4164  break;
4165  case 0x05:
4166  case 0x06:
4167  // MBC2
4168  mapper = mapperMBC2ROM;
4169  mapperRAM = mapperMBC2RAM;
4170  gbRamSize = 0x200;
4171  gbRamSizeMask = 0x1ff;
4172  break;
4173  case 0x0b:
4174  case 0x0c:
4175  case 0x0d:
4176  // MMM01
4177  mapper = mapperMMM01ROM;
4178  mapperRAM = mapperMMM01RAM;
4179  break;
4180  case 0x0f:
4181  case 0x10:
4182  case 0x11:
4183  case 0x12:
4184  case 0x13:
4185  case 0xfc:
4186  // MBC 3
4187  mapper = mapperMBC3ROM;
4188  mapperRAM = mapperMBC3RAM;
4189  mapperReadRAM = mapperMBC3ReadRAM;
4190  break;
4191  case 0x19:
4192  case 0x1a:
4193  case 0x1b:
4194  // MBC5
4195  mapper = mapperMBC5ROM;
4196  mapperRAM = mapperMBC5RAM;
4197  mapperReadRAM = mapperMBC5ReadRAM;
4198  break;
4199  case 0x1c:
4200  case 0x1d:
4201  case 0x1e:
4202  // MBC 5 Rumble
4203  mapper = mapperMBC5ROM;
4204  mapperRAM = mapperMBC5RAM;
4205  mapperReadRAM = mapperMBC5ReadRAM;
4206  break;
4207  case 0x22:
4208  // MBC 7
4209  mapper = mapperMBC7ROM;
4210  mapperRAM = mapperMBC7RAM;
4211  mapperReadRAM = mapperMBC7ReadRAM;
4212  break;
4213  // GG (GameGenie)
4214  case 0x55:
4215  mapper = mapperGGROM;
4216  break;
4217  case 0x56:
4218  // GS (GameShark)
4219  mapper = mapperGS3ROM;
4220  break;
4221  case 0xfd:
4222  // TAMA5
4223  if (gbRam!= NULL)
4224  {
4225  free(gbRam);
4226  gbRam = NULL;
4227  }
4228 
4229  ramsize = 3;
4230  gbRamSize = gbRamSizes[3];
4231  gbRamSizeMask = gbRamSizesMasks[3];
4232  gbRam = (u8 *)malloc(gbRamSize);
4233  memset(gbRam, 0x0, gbRamSize);
4234 
4235  gbTAMA5ramSize = 0x100;
4236 
4237  if (gbTAMA5ram == NULL)
4238  gbTAMA5ram = (u8 *)malloc(gbTAMA5ramSize);
4239  memset(gbTAMA5ram, 0x0, gbTAMA5ramSize);
4240 
4241  mapperRAM = mapperTAMA5RAM;
4242  mapperReadRAM = mapperTAMA5ReadRAM;
4243  mapperUpdateClock = memoryUpdateTAMA5Clock;
4244  break;
4245  case 0xfe:
4246  // HuC3
4247  mapper = mapperHuC3ROM;
4248  mapperRAM = mapperHuC3RAM;
4249  mapperReadRAM = mapperHuC3ReadRAM;
4250  break;
4251  case 0xff:
4252  // HuC1
4253  mapper = mapperHuC1ROM;
4254  mapperRAM = mapperHuC1RAM;
4255  break;
4256  default:
4257  systemMessage(MSG_UNKNOWN_CARTRIDGE_TYPE,
4258  N_("Unknown cartridge type %02x"), gbRomType);
4259  return false;
4260  }
4261 
4262  switch(gbRomType) {
4263  case 0x03:
4264  case 0x06:
4265  case 0x0f:
4266  case 0x10:
4267  case 0x13:
4268  case 0x1b:
4269  case 0x1d:
4270  case 0x1e:
4271  case 0x22:
4272  case 0xfd:
4273  case 0xff:
4274  gbBattery = 1;
4275  break;
4276  }
4277 
4278  gbInit();
4279 
4280  //gbReset();
4281 
4282  switch(gbRomType) {
4283  case 0x1c:
4284  case 0x1d:
4285  case 0x1e:
4286  gbDataMBC5.isRumbleCartridge = 1;
4287  }
4288 
4289  return true;
4290 }

4292 int gbGetNextEvent (int clockTicks)
4293 {
4294  if (register_LCDC & 0x80)
4295  {
4296  if(gbLcdTicks < clockTicks)
4297  clockTicks = gbLcdTicks;
4298 
4299  if(gbLcdTicksDelayed < clockTicks)
4300  clockTicks = gbLcdTicksDelayed;
4301 
4302  if(gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed < clockTicks)
4303  clockTicks = gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed;
4304  }
4305 
4306  if(gbLcdLYIncrementTicks < clockTicks)
4307  clockTicks = gbLcdLYIncrementTicks;
4308 
4309  if(gbSerialOn && (gbSerialTicks < clockTicks))
4310  clockTicks = gbSerialTicks;
4311 
4312  if(gbTimerOn && (((gbInternalTimer) & gbTimerMask[gbTimerMode])+1 < clockTicks))
4313  clockTicks = ((gbInternalTimer) & gbTimerMask[gbTimerMode])+1;
4314 
4315  if(soundTicks && (soundTicks < clockTicks))
4316  clockTicks = soundTicks;
4317 
4318  if ((clockTicks<=0) || (gbInterruptWait))
4319  clockTicks = 1;
4320 
4321  return clockTicks;
4322 }

4434 
4435 void gbEmulate(int ticksToStop)
4436 {
4437  gbRegister tempRegister;
4438  u8 tempValue;
4439  s8 offset;
4440 
4441  clockTicks = 0;
4442  gbDmaTicks = 0;
4443 
4444  register int opcode = 0;
4445 
4446  int opcode1 = 0;
4447  int opcode2 = 0;
4448  bool execute = false;
4449 
4450  while(1) {
4451 #ifndef FINAL_VERSION
4452  if(systemDebug) {
4453  if(!(IFF & 0x80)) {
4454  if(systemDebug > 1) {
4455  sprintf(gbBuffer,"PC=%04x AF=%04x BC=%04x DE=%04x HL=%04x SP=%04x I=%04x\n",
4456  PC.W, AF.W, BC.W, DE.W,HL.W,SP.W,IFF);
4457  } else {
4458  sprintf(gbBuffer,"PC=%04x I=%02x\n", PC.W, IFF);
4459  }
4460  log(gbBuffer);
4461  }
4462  }
4463 #endif
4464 
4465  u16 oldPCW = PC.W;
4466 
4467  if(IFF & 0x80) {
4468  if(register_LCDC & 0x80) {
4469  clockTicks = gbLcdTicks;
4470  } else
4471  clockTicks = 1000;
4472 
4473  clockTicks = gbGetNextEvent(clockTicks);
4474 
4475  /*if(gbLcdTicksDelayed < clockTicks)
4476  clockTicks = gbLcdTicksDelayed;
4477 
4478  if(gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed < clockTicks)
4479  clockTicks = gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed;
4480 
4481  if(gbLcdLYIncrementTicks < clockTicks)
4482  clockTicks = gbLcdLYIncrementTicks;
4483 
4484  if(gbSerialOn && (gbSerialTicks < clockTicks))
4485  clockTicks = gbSerialTicks;
4486 
4487  if(gbTimerOn && (((gbInternalTimer) & gbTimerMask[gbTimerMode])+1 < clockTicks))
4488  clockTicks = ((gbInternalTimer) & gbTimerMask[gbTimerMode])+1;
4489 
4490  if(soundTicks && (soundTicks < clockTicks))
4491  clockTicks = soundTicks;
4492 
4493  if ((clockTicks<=0) || (gbInterruptWait))
4494  clockTicks = 1;*/
4495 
4496  } else {
4497 
4498  // First we apply the clockTicks, then we execute the opcodes.
4499  opcode1 = 0;
4500  opcode2 = 0;
4501  execute = true;
4502 
4503  opcode2 = opcode1 = opcode = gbReadOpcode(PC.W++);
4504 
4505  // If HALT state was launched while IME = 0 and (register_IF & register_IE & 0x1F),
4506  // PC.W is not incremented for the first byte of the next instruction.
4507  if (IFF & 2)
4508  {
4509  PC.W--;
4510  IFF &= ~2;
4511  }
4512 
4513  clockTicks = gbCycles[opcode];
4514 
4515  switch(opcode) {
4516  case 0xCB:
4517  // extended opcode
4518  opcode2 = opcode = gbReadOpcode(PC.W++);
4519  clockTicks = gbCyclesCB[opcode];
4520  break;
4521  }
4522  gbOldClockTicks = clockTicks-1;
4523  gbIntBreak = 1;
4524  }
4525 
4526 
4527  if(!emulating)
4528  return;
4529 
4530  // For 'breakpoint' support (opcode 0xFC is considered as a breakpoint)
4531  if ((clockTicks==0) && execute)
4532  {
4533  PC.W = oldPCW;
4534  return;
4535  }
4536 
4537 
4538  if (!(IFF & 0x80))
4539  clockTicks = 1;
4540 
4541  gbRedoLoop:
4542 
4543 
4544 
4545  if (gbInterruptWait)
4546  gbInterruptWait = 0;
4547  else
4548  gbInterruptLaunched = 0;
4549 
4550 
4551  // Used for the EI/DI instruction's delay.
4552  if (IFF & 0x38)
4553  {
4554  int tempIFF = (IFF >> 4) & 3;
4555 
4556  if (tempIFF <=clockTicks)
4557  {
4558  tempIFF = 0;
4559  IFF |=1;
4560  }
4561  else
4562  tempIFF -= clockTicks;
4563  IFF = (IFF & 0xCF) | (tempIFF <<4);
4564 
4565  if (IFF & 0x08)
4566  IFF &= 0x82;
4567  }
4568 
4569 
4570  if (register_LCDCBusy)
4571  {
4572  register_LCDCBusy-=clockTicks;
4573  if (register_LCDCBusy<0)
4574  register_LCDCBusy = 0;
4575  }
4576 
4577 
4578  if(gbSgbMode) {
4579  if(gbSgbPacketTimeout) {
4580  gbSgbPacketTimeout -= clockTicks;
4581 
4582  if(gbSgbPacketTimeout <= 0)
4583  gbSgbResetPacketState();
4584  }
4585  }
4586 
4587  ticksToStop -= clockTicks;
4588 
4589  // DIV register emulation
4590  gbDivTicks -= clockTicks;
4591  while(gbDivTicks <= 0) {
4592  gbMemory[0xff04] = ++register_DIV;
4593  gbDivTicks += GBDIV_CLOCK_TICKS;
4594  }
4595 
4596  if(register_LCDC & 0x80) {
4597  // LCD stuff
4598 
4599  gbLcdTicks -= clockTicks;
4600  gbLcdTicksDelayed -= clockTicks;
4601  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks -= clockTicks;
4602  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed -= clockTicks;
4603 
4604 
4605  // our counters are off, see what we need to do
4606 
4607  // This looks (and kinda is) complicated, however this
4608  // is the only way I found to emulate properly the way
4609  // the real hardware operates...
4610  while(((gbLcdTicks <= 0) && (gbLCDChangeHappened == false)) ||
4611  ((gbLcdTicksDelayed <= 0) && (gbLCDChangeHappened == true)) ||
4612  ((gbLcdLYIncrementTicks <= 0) && (gbLYChangeHappened == false)) ||
4613  ((gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed<=0) && (gbLYChangeHappened == true)))
4614  {
4615 
4616  if ((gbLcdLYIncrementTicks <= 0) && (!gbLYChangeHappened))
4617  {
4618  gbLYChangeHappened = true;
4619  gbMemory[0xff44] = register_LY = (register_LY + 1) % 154;
4620 
4621  if (register_LY == 0x91)
4622  {
4623  /* if (IFF & 0x80)
4624  gbScreenOn = !gbScreenOn;
4625  else*/ if (register_LCDC & 0x80)
4626  gbScreenOn = true;
4627  }
4628 
4629  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks += GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS;
4630 
4631  if (gbLcdMode == 1)
4632  {
4633 
4634  if(register_LY == 153)
4635  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks -= GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS - gbLine99Ticks;
4636  else if(register_LY == 0)
4637  gbLcdLYIncrementTicks += GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS - gbLine99Ticks;
4638  }
4639 
4640  // GB only 'bug' : Halt state is broken one tick before LY==LYC interrupt
4641  // is reflected in the registers.
4642  if ((gbHardware & 5) && (IFF & 0x80) && (register_LY == register_LYC)
4643  && (register_STAT & 0x40) && (register_LY != 0))
4644  {
4645  if (!((gbLcdModeDelayed != 1) && (register_LY==0)))
4646  {
4647  gbInt48Signal &= ~9;
4648  gbCompareLYToLYC();
4649  gbLYChangeHappened = false;
4650  gbMemory[0xff41] = register_STAT;
4651  gbMemory[0xff0f] = register_IF;
4652  }
4653 
4654  gbLcdLYIncrementTicksDelayed += GBLY_INCREMENT_CLOCK_TICKS - gbLine99Ticks+1;
4655  }
4656  }
4657 
4658 
4659  if ((gbLcdTicks <= 0) && (!gbLCDChangeHappened))
4660  {
4661  gbLCDChangeHappened = true;
4662 
4663  switch(gbLcdMode)
4664  {
4665  case 0:
4666  {
4667  // H-Blank
4668  // check if we reached the V-Blank period
4669  if(register_LY == 144) {
4670  // Yes, V-Blank
4671  // set the LY increment counter
4672  if (gbHardware & 0x5)
4673  {
4674  register_IF |= 1; // V-Blank interrupt
4675  }
4676 
4677  gbInt48Signal &= ~6;
4678  if(register_STAT & 0x10)
4679  {
4680  // send LCD interrupt only if no interrupt 48h signal...
4681  if ((!(gbInt48Signal & 1)) && ((!(gbInt48Signal & 8)) || (gbHardware & 0x0a)))
4682  {
4683  register_IF |=2;
4684  gbInterruptLaunched |= 2;
4685  if (gbHardware & 0xa)
4686  gbInterruptWait = 1;
4687  }
4688  gbInt48Signal |= 2;
4689  }
4690  gbInt48Signal &= ~1;
4691 
4692  gbLcdTicks += GBLCD_MODE_1_CLOCK_TICKS;
4693  gbLcdMode = 1;
4694 
4695  } else {
4696  // go the the OAM being accessed mode
4697  gbLcdTicks += GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS;
4698  gbLcdMode = 2;
4699 
4700  gbInt48Signal &= ~6;
4701  if(register_STAT & 0x20)
4702  {
4703  // send LCD interrupt only if no interrupt 48h signal...
4704  if (!gbInt48Signal)
4705  {
4706  register_IF |= 2;
4707  gbInterruptLaunched |= 2;
4708  }
4709  gbInt48Signal |= 4;
4710  }
4711  gbInt48Signal &= ~1;
4712  }
4713  }
4714  break;
4715  case 1:
4716  {
4717  // V-Blank
4718  // next mode is OAM being accessed mode
4719  gbInt48Signal &= ~5;
4720  if(register_STAT & 0x20)
4721  {
4722  // send LCD interrupt only if no interrupt 48h signal...
4723  if (!gbInt48Signal)
4724  {
4725  register_IF |= 2;
4726  gbInterruptLaunched |= 2;
4727  if ((gbHardware & 0xa) && (IFF & 0x80))
4728  gbInterruptWait = 1;
4729  }
4730  gbInt48Signal |= 4;
4731  }
4732  gbInt48Signal &= ~2;
4733 
4734  gbLcdTicks += GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS;
4735 
4736  gbLcdMode = 2;
4737  register_LY = 0x00;
4738 
4739  }
4740  break;
4741  case 2:
4742  {
4743 
4744  // OAM being accessed mode
4745  // next mode is OAM and VRAM in use
4746  if ((gbScreenOn) && (register_LCDC & 0x80))
4747  {
4748  gbDrawSprites(false);
4749  // Used to add a one tick delay when a window line is drawn.
4750  //(fixes a part of Carmaggedon problem)
4751  if((register_LCDC & 0x01 || gbCgbMode) && (register_LCDC & 0x20) &&
4752  (gbWindowLine != -2)) {
4753 
4754  int inUseRegister_WY = 0;
4755  int tempgbWindowLine = gbWindowLine;
4756 
4757  if ((tempgbWindowLine == -1) || (tempgbWindowLine>144))
4758  {
4759  inUseRegister_WY = oldRegister_WY;
4760  if (register_LY>oldRegister_WY)
4761  tempgbWindowLine = 146;
4762  }
4763 
4764  int wy = inUseRegister_WY;
4765 
4766  if(register_LY >= inUseRegister_WY) {
4767 
4768  if (tempgbWindowLine == -1)
4769  tempgbWindowLine = 0;
4770 
4771  int wx = register_WX;
4772  wx -= 7;
4773  if (wx<0)
4774  wx = 0;
4775 
4776  if((wx <= 159) && (tempgbWindowLine <= 143))
4777  for (int i = wx; i<300; i++)
4778  if (gbSpeed)
4779  gbSpritesTicks[i]+=3;
4780  else
4781  gbSpritesTicks[i]+=1;
4782  }
4783  }
4784  }
4785 
4786  gbInt48Signal &= ~7;
4787 
4788  gbLcdTicks += GBLCD_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS+gbSpritesTicks[299];
4789  gbLcdMode = 3;
4790  }
4791  break;
4792  case 3:
4793  {
4794  // OAM and VRAM in use
4795  // next mode is H-Blank
4796 
4797 
4798  gbInt48Signal &= ~7;
4799  if(register_STAT & 0x08)
4800  {
4801  // send LCD interrupt only if no interrupt 48h signal...
4802  if (!(gbInt48Signal & 8))
4803  {
4804  register_IF |= 2;
4805  if ((gbHardware & 0xa) && (IFF & 0x80))
4806  gbInterruptWait = 1;
4807  }
4808  gbInt48Signal |= 1;
4809  }
4810 
4811  gbLcdTicks += GBLCD_MODE_0_CLOCK_TICKS-gbSpritesTicks[299];
4812 
4813  gbLcdMode = 0;
4814 
4815  // No HDMA during HALT !
4816  if(gbHdmaOn && (!(IFF & 0x80) || (register_IE & register_IF & 0x1f))) {
4817  gbDoHdma();
4818  }
4819 
4820  }
4821  break;
4822  }
4823  }
4824 
4825 
4826  if ((gbLcdTicksDelayed <= 0) && (gbLCDChangeHappened)) {
4827  int framesToSkip = systemFrameSkip;
4828  if(speedup)
4829  framesToSkip = 9; // try 6 FPS during speedup
4830  //gbLcdTicksDelayed = gbLcdTicks+1;
4831  gbLCDChangeHappened = false;
4832  switch(gbLcdModeDelayed) {
4833  case 0:
4834  {
4835  // H-Blank
4836 
4837  memset(gbSCYLine,gbSCYLine[299],sizeof(gbSCYLine));
4838  memset(gbSCXLine,gbSCXLine[299],sizeof(gbSCXLine));
4839  memset(gbBgpLine,gbBgpLine[299],sizeof(gbBgpLine));
4840  memset(gbObp0Line,gbObp0Line[299],sizeof(gbObp0Line));
4841  memset(gbObp1Line,gbObp1Line[299],sizeof(gbObp1Line));
4842  memset(gbSpritesTicks,gbSpritesTicks[299],sizeof(gbSpritesTicks));
4843 
4844  if (gbWindowLine <0)
4845  oldRegister_WY = register_WY;
4846  // check if we reached the V-Blank period
4847  if(register_LY == 144) {
4848  // Yes, V-Blank
4849  // set the LY increment counter
4850 
4851  if(register_LCDC & 0x80) {
4852  if (gbHardware & 0xa)
4853  {
4854 
4855  register_IF |= 1; // V-Blank interrupt
4856  gbInterruptLaunched |=1;
4857  }
4858 
4859 
4860  }
4861 
4862  gbLcdTicksDelayed += GBLCD_MODE_1_CLOCK_TICKS;
4863  gbLcdModeDelayed = 1;
4864 
4865  gbFrameCount++;
4866  systemFrame();
4867 
4868  if((gbFrameCount % 10) == 0)
4869  system10Frames(60);
4870 
4871  if(gbFrameCount >= 60) {
4872  u32 currentTime = systemGetClock();
4873  if(currentTime != gbLastTime)
4874  systemShowSpeed(100000/(currentTime - gbLastTime));
4875  else
4876  systemShowSpeed(0);
4877  gbLastTime = currentTime;
4878  gbFrameCount = 0;
4879  }
4880 
4881  if(systemReadJoypads()) {
4882  // read joystick
4883  if(gbSgbMode && gbSgbMultiplayer) {
4884  if(gbSgbFourPlayers) {
4885  gbJoymask[0] = systemReadJoypad(0);
4886  gbJoymask[1] = systemReadJoypad(1);
4887  gbJoymask[2] = systemReadJoypad(2);
4888  gbJoymask[3] = systemReadJoypad(3);
4889  } else {
4890  gbJoymask[0] = systemReadJoypad(0);
4891  gbJoymask[1] = systemReadJoypad(1);
4892  }
4893  } else {
4894  gbJoymask[0] = systemReadJoypad(-1);
4895  }
4896  }
4897  int newmask = gbJoymask[0] & 255;
4898 
4899  if(gbRomType == 0x22) {
4900  systemUpdateMotionSensor();
4901  }
4902 
4903  if(newmask)
4904  {
4905  gbMemory[0xff0f] |= 16;
4906  }
4907 
4908 
4909  newmask = (gbJoymask[0] >> 10);
4910 
4911  speedup = (newmask & 1) ? true : false;
4912  gbCapture = (newmask & 2) ? true : false;
4913 
4914  if(gbCapture && !gbCapturePrevious) {
4915  gbCaptureNumber++;
4916  systemScreenCapture(gbCaptureNumber);
4917  }
4918  gbCapturePrevious = gbCapture;
4919 
4920  if(gbFrameSkipCount >= framesToSkip) {
4921 
4922  if(!gbSgbMask)
4923  {
4924  if (gbBorderOn)
4925  gbSgbRenderBorder();
4926  //if (gbScreenOn)
4927  systemDrawScreen();
4928  }
4929  gbFrameSkipCount = 0;
4930  } else
4931  gbFrameSkipCount++;
4932 
4933  } else {
4934  // go the the OAM being accessed mode
4935  gbLcdTicksDelayed += GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS;
4936  gbLcdModeDelayed = 2;
4937  gbInt48Signal &= ~3;
4938  }
4939  }
4940  break;
4941  case 1:
4942  {
4943  // V-Blank
4944  // next mode is OAM being accessed mode
4945 
4946  // gbScreenOn = true;
4947 
4948  oldRegister_WY = register_WY;
4949 
4950  gbLcdTicksDelayed += GBLCD_MODE_2_CLOCK_TICKS;
4951  gbLcdModeDelayed = 2;
4952 
4953  // reset the window line
4954  gbWindowLine = -1;
4955  }
4956  break;
4957  case 2:
4958  {
4959  // OAM being accessed mode
4960  // next mode is OAM and VRAM in use
4961  gbLcdTicksDelayed += GBLCD_MODE_3_CLOCK_TICKS+gbSpritesTicks[299];
4962  gbLcdModeDelayed = 3;
4963  }
4964  break;
4965  case 3:
4966  {
4967 
4968  // OAM and VRAM in use
